I just waned to add another voice to the chorus of people who think this is a fantastic pocket camera.  Its small size is amazing. And for me, the big advantage is I can always have it with me and not even think about it.  Sure, large cameras can give you marginally better photos.  If you're a perfectionist, get an SLR be known as the guy with the huge camera.  But if you want solid quality shots of life as it happens without being encumbered, the SD780IS is perfect.  The HD video is a major plus.  Many have complained about the viewfinder -- yeah, it stinks, but great to have it when you don't want to use the LCD and it's perfectly adequate for basic shot framing.  Battery life is good.  Just get a generic spare on Amazon for only a few bucks and carry the spare if you're going on a trip.  And spring for a 16GB SD card if you like to take video.  In short, a fantastic camera for the size.

Reviews.Title: VERY small but great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Storrs
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a camera for my father and settled on this one as I have a Canon Elph SD750 and love it.  This SD 780IS is a great camera that takes excellent photos and has one of my favorite features which is the recovery time til you can take your next pic is very short.  I was taken aback, however, by the size of this camera.  I figured it would be the same size as my SD750 but it is quite a bit smaller which in turn makes the screen smaller.  Still nice sized screen and very clear though.  The problem is most men have larger fingers and it is hard for him to power on the camera and navigate with the buttons on it.Beware though of buying the case that is designed for this camera.  I purchased the case for my SD750 (the black leather one with metal clasp made to fit the camera) and it is perfect.  The case made for this SD780IS though, does not fit the camera.  Maybe once it gets stretched out it would fit it, but it doesn't now.  And they have change the magnetic clasp and it is very weak.  Will not lay flat with camera in case.  ALSO on the one I ordered, the little screw holding the clasp on was stripped and when I took the camera out of case the first time it scratched the screen.  I was extremely disappointed to have this new camera with a scratched screen and called Amazon.  They are replacing it for me.  I see that as a testimate to Amazon's customer service policy and will definitely order from them in the future!

Reviews.Title: Freaking awesome
Reviews.Author: J. N. Sanders "Jnsanders"
Reviews.Content: Tiny little camera, big time quality. It's smaller than most cell phones I've ever seen, but better than some of the larger model cameras I've seen. The zoom, only being at 3x, isn't that impressive, but even when fully zoomed, in a van, going down a bumpy road in the middle of nowhere iraq, the image will still come out crystal clear with awesome 12.1 mp definition. It's the best point and shoot camera I've ever seen and in my opinion canon is the best quality camera maker for durablility and quality of pictures. Highly recommended camera.

Reviews.Title: NETBOOK USERS BEWARE....
Reviews.Author: D. J. Auerbach "dja"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera in all aspects, you definitely get the biggest bank for your buck here. I own two other digital cameras and bought this one because the compact size is perfect for travel, and I absolutely must have a viewfinder.HOWEVER, there is one issue that NETBOOK users should be aware of: You cannot install the Canon software CD for photo editing on your netbook. The screen resolution is not high enough and cannot be increased. (I have a 10" Acer Aspire with Win XP OS). I installed the software on my laptop and PC without a problem.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Melundie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on as a replacement for my 5MP Kodak EasyShare that took absolutely GORGEOUS photos on the Auto setting. I often used the SCN settings on my Kodak even though auto worked just fine (if not better than the scenes).I will say I am a bit disappointed at the Auto feature on this camera. This is a point-and-shoot camera and as such I feel that the Auto setting should be much better than it is. After reading lots of reviews all about Canon's "Smart Auto" I figured this would be a good buy. I will say that the Smart Auto is kind of cool and it definitely works, but pictures are not at all what they should be (on Auto) for a 12MP camera. That is, however, my only real complaint.After reading over the manual I have started playing with the Canon's scene settings--there are a lot of these, which is fantastic. Though there are some scenes that are pretty worthless in my opinion (read: underwater, fireworks). The camera takes MUCH better pictures when you use the scene settings. MUCH, MUCH better. I do wish that there was an "Outside/Sunny" setting because I find that using "Beach" or "Snow" do not work at all on a bright day...they just throw the white balance of the photo way off. I've even tried setting the ISO to 100 or 200, but even on a bright day the image is not as clear as I would expect with all those MPs!Video is OK. Sucks that you can't use the zoom. However, I really like the HD feature and the fact that you can plug right into your TV to view videos and pictures in HD.Overall, this is a phenomenal camera for the price. The SCN settings do take a while to get the hang of, but it's sturdy and the flat black coloring is awesome. I would have LOVED to get the gold, but it's for some reason $100 more?! Odd.. Anyway, I would definitely buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Super - Spots on lens or sensor fixed for free -- better than ever
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: A great camera except for fact that dust, dirt, or something have put spots on the photos after six months of use.  *****Update - Canon fixed for free - one week, great service

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love having an HD camera in my pocket.
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this camera.  We just took this my Nikon Nikon D700 12.1MP Digital SLR Camera (Body Only), Canon VIXIA HF S10 HD Dual Flash Memory with 32 GB Internal Memory and 10x Optical Zoom, and the Canon PowerShot SD780IS12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Black). We used the D700 maybe twice and the HFS10 never.  This camera took amazing shots and video.  Highly portable and like they say, the best camera you can shoot with is the one you have with you.

Reviews.Title: As good as they say it is.
Reviews.Author: Mudslide Slim
Reviews.Content: My first generation digital Canon camera final gave up after lots of heavy use and abuse. In looking for a replacement there were so many positive reviews on the SD780 that I wondered if it was some sort of marketing gimmick. Well, I liked the styling, the specs, and the price so I thought I'd take a chance on it and can now see why others were so enthusiastic.To be honest when I first opened the box the camera was about the size of a deck of cards and was quite smaller than I expected. I wondered if I could even work the buttons. No worries. The size grew on me (if you will excuse the pun) and although the power button is smaller than I would prefer, the rest of the controls can be manipulated comfortably. I bought the gold color camera and think it's beautiful.For starters the camera is pretty intuitive if you just want to jump into it, but I recommend studying the manual at some point to really understand the finer points and incredible features. By the way, unlike others, this manual is very well written and useful. You can also download a pdf version from the Canon website. The "auto" mode is a no-brainer, but using the varied programmed settings is pretty easy. I like the fact that a particular program function has a plain English title to go with the icon since icons always confuse me. I don't take much video, but it worked amazingly well for a small camera. The clarity and colors of the still photos were a huge improvement from my previous camera. I'm still learning and playing though.One of the big features for me is the digital macro function. I use my camera extensively in business and often need to take macro shots of components. I was blown away by this capability. It was better than my macro lenses on my old SLR 35mm cameras. Just read the manual instructions first.I was surprised that it didn't come with a memory card so I ordered a 4GB which is adequate for my needs. I do recommend a case and the LCD screen protector that will protect the display from scratches, fingerprints and is supposed to reduce glare. With the understanding that there is not much real estate on this camera, my improvement wish list would be for a larger power button, a better access door to the USB/HDMI ports, and a plug in charger so you don't have to take the battery out. Bottom line is that I am really enjoying this camera and have no hesitation to recommend it with the understanding that it is small.

Reviews.Title: Compact and feature rich
Reviews.Author: vatsan
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a point-and-shoot for my wife and I knew it had to be something small that she wouldn't mind carrying in her jacket/jeans pocket or handbag. Also I wanted this camera to complement my dslr, in terms of compactness and features. I'm happy to say the SD780IS does the job excellently. Its unbelievably sleek, making it as portable as a cellphone. And its got a ton of shooting modes - in my most recent vacation I could absolutely find a shooting mode for every scenario I was in. Love it!And briefly on how I narrowed down on this camera - I'm a Canon fan so didn't look anywhere else, and the SD1200IS and SD780IS were the two options in my price range. To compare the SD780IS with a SD1200IS, I feel the SD780IS is well worth the few extra bucks considering you get HD video and a much slimmer camera.

Reviews.Title: it's decent.
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: the shutter lag is what kind of annoys me, but this thing is SO tiny and easy to throw in your bag that it's great for candids when just hanging out with friends. I am happy to always have it lying around in case ther'es an unexpected photo opp waiting around the corner but sometimes nothing beats an SRL, even if they are rather heavy. The video feature is also quite nice, though like other reviewers said, it's a shame you can't zoom while filming.

Reviews.Title: A little jewel
Reviews.Author: Indiana Limestone
Reviews.Content: This is overall a fantastic camera. I bought it to replace another Canon (Elph 1000) which worked well in closeup/macro situations but not so well in poor light or glare, and had some general issues with light quality and focus. So I had some trepidations, but figured - or rather, hoped - that Canon had worked out the bugs on the earlier elph (which I bought in 2007). This one is a revelation - it's simply a superb little camera that pretends it's an SRL. My wife wanted a small camera for her archival work, and I wanted something that was versatile and had an effective macro. Both of us wanted a camera with high quality video (Check) and a children and pets setting (for photos of our toddler and pets - check!).Only two negatives: the zoom is fairly useless, and the auto setting is to be avoided, as it tries to do everything to prevent the flash from going off - specifically, what it defaults is relatively long aperture (1/15 or 1/10 sec) and high ISO settings. As a consequence, lots of photos taken on AUTO look blurry or out of focus. The PROGram setting is brilliant, though, and the optics components seem really quite good (esp. for the price). I've taken about 2000 photos in the last 2 months, and could not be happier (and did I mention the price?)

Reviews.Title: SD780IS - highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: MarkC
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Canon PowerShot digital camera. I take my camera everywhere on trips, and usually throw it in my pocket...and they have all lasted longer than they should have. Reliable picture quality. Plenty of custom settings. I love it...was worried about the smaller 2.5" display (last Canon had 3" display),  but barely notice the difference. I love the HD video capturing ability, nice small and compact design. Though the brushed aluminum finish makes it slippery, extra care is needed when taking pictures, making sure you have the wrist strap on. I rarely even shoot in full 12MP size, because I share pictures online most of the time....5MB setting is more than enough. Great battery life. Great image quality. Sturdy outter design. I definitely recommend this camera...easy to tuck in your pocket anywhere you go!

Reviews.Title: The Always Carry Camera
Reviews.Author: Rocannon MacGregor "zenfire"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my Canon SD870IS. I use my little pocket cameras to video outdoor primal movement that I then edit them into training DVDs and needed a bit better video capacity. The SD780IS gives me that, plus outstanding still photography and it is even smaller. The HD video excellent. We compared it to the video from the SD870IS and my waterproof Canon D10. The difference is significant.The controls are typical Canon style and easy for me to use. Because of the smaller size it took me maybe a day of use to get myself adjusted to it.I have taken video in some extremely low light situations and been very impressed with it.The battery is excellent and of course I bought a second one for when I am doing lots of video.So far this is my favorite Always Carry Camera. I hiked up to a waterfall the other day and captured a rainbow in the falls. This camera really does job.

Reviews.Title: This camera rocks...
Reviews.Author: O. Petoskey
Reviews.Content: For fine still photography, I'm a Nikon man. For video or pocket cameras, I love Canon. Though my venerable Canon Powershot SD-450IS still works perfectly, it's just 5 megapixel and the 4 year old battery had worn out. As I searched for a replacement battery, I also found reviews and videos on this Canon Powershot SD-780IS.Turns out, this camera has all the great features and easy of use of my older camera, even better construction quality and shot brilliant 12 megapixel and 720p HD Video. It has better Image Stabilization (IS), beautiful color reproduction and a high quality feel. It won't replace an HD Camcorder, but for the money and size, it can't be beat. My only complain with the Powershot series is that none of these cameras will allow you to save images in their raw format, saving in processed jpeg format.  But te average shooter won't be doing extensive image processing, and the image quality is high enough that you still have no problem getting 11x14 (or larger!) paper prints if desired from good quality images. If you're looking for a full-featured, shirt pocket camera that shoots great video with excellent low light capability, the SD-780IS answer! I recommend it, even over the newer SD-940IS.

Reviews.Title: Excellent small camera for capturing all events
Reviews.Author: S. Viswanathan "Kumar"
Reviews.Content: An excellent camera that is small, cute and very effective. Do not be fooled by size, size does not matter. I brought this camera a month back and took it to my trip to Singapore without reading the manual. Took 800 photos and 760 of them came out very well. Ease of use, portability, and convenience are the hallmarks of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: D. Palmer
Reviews.Content: Received the camera for Christmas and even though I wanted this camera after doing research, I was a litte awed by all it offers.  I am not a photo buff that will talk your ears off about tech specs but wanted a camera that I could take my daughter's pictures of events inside in low light after years of other cameras not being able to do the job right. It has features I am still studying how to use and the software that came with the camera is powerful enough for me to do all kinds of things.  The camera takes very good low light pictures which is what I wanted. The camera itself is a sophisticated computer system nevermind the computer with the software.  A bit smaller than I had in mind and if you have large fingers...you might have an issue as controls are very small. Takes awesome everyday pictures though!

Reviews.Title: Bring it with you everywhere you go!
Reviews.Author: How K. Liew "Victor Liew"
Reviews.Content: I've been using Sony Cybershot T7 (with very slim & cool outlook) for the past few years. It has 2 weaknesses:(1) The body is so thin & sensitive that those with shaky hands will not get sharp photos.(2) The stabilizer for this model isn't good enough.  So it produces unacceptable blurry photos to capture movement.As I'm taking more & more pictures nowadays with my frequent biz trips, I'm looking for another value buy camera which suits my style well & meets below criterion:(1) reasonable price(2) mini size & easy to carry(3) reputable brand(4) good stabilizer for movement capturing(5) user friendly features(6) quality downloaded photosHere it goes, Canon powershot SD780IS! Now I almost rely on it for all my new photos.  I just encountered once whereby it showed 'Lens error' & asked me to change my battery pack (I remembered I charged it full at home) when I wanted to use it outside during New Year eve.  I'm not sure whether it's because of the very cold temperature below zero which caused the disconnection of the battery pack.  It resumed working when I was back in the train.Overall, you won't regret to own it!

Reviews.Title: Fine.  Just fine.
Reviews.Author: Gary Palangian "Silver Lining"
Reviews.Content: I use it for Point and Shoot. It's small, easy to handle, looks cool, takes great pictures, has resolution good enough for 8x10 prints.  I love it.  The only shortcoming is the flash.  It's way too weak for anything but the closest flash shots.  Oh, I bought a three battery pack from Amazon to go with it and always have a couple of batteries with me cause nothing sucks more like having a dead battery when you want to snap a photo.  The cheapy, no-name batteries I bought (like 3 for $10) are just as good as the "Canon" battery.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera and great pics!!!!
Reviews.Author: Suzette Glynn "Suzi Q"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas gift to myself, it has become one of the best investments I've made.  The pictures on this camera are the clearest and best pictures I've ever taken. Right now, I am extremely satisfied with the ease of using this camera seeing that I am not really good at working camera's.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly clear photos and extremely portable
Reviews.Author: Douglas P. Atkinson
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for my birthday - but I had been eying for a long time.  In the past two weeks, I have used it at office parties, practicing inside shots with, and taken a few outside shots with it.  I've been playing with the macro settings which offer amazingly clear photos from the 12.1 mpix quality.I'm such an amateur at photography but I have LOVED learning using this camera.  If a picture's worth a thousand words, see my blog at [...]All photos there have been taken in the past two weeks with this camera.The only slight disappointment was that the camera doesn't come with any memory card to begin with so be sure and order that along with the camera.  I ended up making a run to the Walgreen's store, twice, before I got the right one to go with this.  If you're going to be taking this with you a lot, I'd recommend a second battery and charger.  For what I've shot, the charge on the battery seems to last about two days.Downloading the photos is a breeze and the software offers a lot more features that I haven't gotten into yet.Being in my 50's, the size of the print on the camera itself is a bit hard to read HOWEVER, the lcd display offers an extremely easy to read set of controls/menus.  Once you've memorized the purpose of the 4 or 5 buttons, the menu's offer a much wider variety of choices and they're so much easier to read.At first I was a bit disappointed that the camera didn't offer more in the way of attachable filters and lenses however a friend reminded me that the trade off for that is that I'm not lugging around a whole suitcase full of supplies, parts, lenses, etc.  This thing fits in your pocket or in a belt holster so easily...The first thing most folks have said is "Wow, I can't believe you're getting THAT much out of that small camera!"

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: K. Spencer
Reviews.Content: I'd been shopping around for a new camera, and bought the Canon Powershot 1100IS, but I wasn't pleased with it.  It didn't seem to do much more than my old camera, which is nearly 5 years old.  So then I came across the 780IS and I love it! I'm a college student, so it was fun to have one in such a bright red color! Also, it easily fits into my pocket, so I can carry it around to football games or parties or wherever else I go. Also, the color accent feature is a lot of fun.  It's easy to use, and you can create some really neat pictures with hardly any work involved.  It's great! I definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Incredibly portable, good pics
Reviews.Author: FGK
Reviews.Content: Very compact and excellant pictures.  The HD video is great, unless you zoom which quickly degrades image quality.  Battery life is very good, and has a ton of present picture modes.  A great buy, especially if you want an ultracompact camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: mruseless "mruseless"
Reviews.Content: The portability of this camera cannot be beat! However, do not expect SLR grade pics with it. Its a point and shoot, and really can do quite a bit. But its not going to give you the best picture quality you've ever seen. Also, the flash is fairly weak, probably due to the small size and power limitations.I was also impressed with the speed. Others have said its slow, but I disagree. From power button press to picture taken is less than 2 seconds.Overall, a great camera for slipping into a pocket and carrying with you.

Reviews.Title: MEC
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen Coddington "MeMa"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after researching different models and companies for six months (as I was in no rush to purchase a new camera.)  I have to say that overall I am pleased with its performance.  The pictures have good color and are crystal clear in most cases.  This little "gem" fits easily into a small purse and is always ready when a photo opportunity arises.One drawback I've found is the shutter speed - even in continuous mode.  This is a  priority for me as I don't want to miss those cute shots of the grandchildren.  The manual indicates that there may be a delay especially if a flash is necessary but I find that no matter what the light, there is always a delay - longer than I would like.  Maybe the camera has a feature that I'm not utilizing???

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Ahreum Cho "The-signer"
Reviews.Content: This camera has many upgrades from it's older Canon SD versions. It's tiny in size but has all the features I wanted. It's AUTO setting is amazing. It's so smart that I dont even need to adjust anything I normally did in MANUAL setting

Reviews.Title: Good overall but very noisy video in mid to low light situations
Reviews.Author: Jordan T. Brooks
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this camera seems good.  The macro mode is nice on these newer cameras.  I (and my wife) are disapointed with the video quality of the canon sd780 in mid to low lighting.  Outdoors during the daytime - video looks great.  In dim lighting the video is extreemly grainy!  Indoors with the lights on at night time in our house video looks grainy, in the kitchen with brighter lighting the video looked ok, maybe slightly grainy.  If you are in a room with less than ideal lighting video looks very grainy/fuzzy.  That was the case last night when we tested it in our greatroom that has average to slightly below average indoor lighting.  We tested it via hdmi to our HDTV and also on my computer.  I had a Canon sx200is (12X optical zoom, 720p video w/ hdmi output).  The video was also grainy indoors at night time with the lights on but I don't think it was as bad as the sd780 (it's hard to say).  I returned the sx200is because if I was going to have a camera with 12Xs zoom I wanted it to zoom during video and I liked the size of the sd780.  The sd780 is a very nice sized little camera.  The 2.5" screen looks great and has the same resolution as the 3" screen on the sx200is, in my opinion the 2.5" looks sharper.  I am happy overall but I don't think it will replace my old HI-8 camcorder in low light situations unfortunately.  And because there is no optical zoom I still will use the camcorder now and then.  But for most situations it is nice to only take this small camera around for pictures and 720p video.If you are looking for a camera that zooms during video (12X optical zoom)and has 720p video w/ hdmi and has great reviews look up the panasonic zs3 (the lcd screen is also sharper vs. the canon - twice as many pixels).  I was debating between that one and the canon sd780.  I chose the canon for the size and the price.  The panisonic is about $399.I almost gave the review 3 stars due to the dim video quality.  But overall this seems to be a nice camera with great features that is a nice size and looks great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the size
Reviews.Author: A. Martin
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SD780 is a great camera.  I was drawn to the camera for its small size and HD video capability.  The camera is comfortable in your hand and has all of the features of a standard point and shoot.I am using a 16GB SD class 6 card for storage.  I am getting 5001 12 megapixel pictures.  Or 86 minutes of HD video.On the plus side:+ Very small form factor+ LCD is bright and crisp+ Optical view finder (can turn off LCD display with one button to save battery)+ On/Off button does not allow for accidental pushing+ Mini HDMI out port+ HD video (720P) is good quality.  Sound is good. (Quicktime MOV files)+ Picture quality is good+ Image stabilization helps alotNeutral or Negatives:- Only 3x optical zoom.  This is probably due to small size of camera.  Would like to see at least 5x- HD video is recorded in .mov quicktime files.  Fine for Mac users, but if you run Windows you will probably need to convert the files before importing them into editing software- Some pictures look a little grainy in lower light

Reviews.Title: Not a fan
Reviews.Author: R. Armstrong "Rebsreviews"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take on vacation to Disneyland. I guess I shouldn't have expected great picture quality out of a point and shoot, but I honestly thought it would be a little better. Unless you are very close, and the subjects are stone still you will get blurs and grain.It is nice and small and easy to carry in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: A Digital Dream Camera
Reviews.Author: RML
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on super sale on "Black Friday" and have been so pleased with it I can hardly contain my excitement. I adore it's sleek design and compact size. A pocket is all you need to carry it around. Despite the camera's small size it has a large screen for viewing. The features are easy to use and the quality is fantastic. I'm so enthralled with this product I cannot recommend it enough. While I'm certainly still learning to use it and all its features, I have already taken twice as many photos as normal and feel they are much better than before I started using the PowerShot. Its portability adds to my desire to shoot more shots. I can carry it anywhere and therefore am more apt to take spontaneous photographs. I bought the Canon in an attempt to improve my amateur photography skills and have been impressed with my progress so far.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised at video Quality
Reviews.Author: P. Wieselquist "Peter Wieselquist"
Reviews.Content: I've used lots of digicams. My initial impression of the SD780IS is that it does a great job for its size, and my Made-in-Japan version seems sturdy and well-built.There are plenty of good reviews here about the PQ of the still shots, so I won't comment there, and I'm not much of a photographer anyway.But for the video, I'm very impressed. I've tried 3 or 4 different still cams that do HD video, and so far the Canon rules them all. It beats the video from my main digicam, a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ5.  Although the TZ5 lets you zoom while shooting, it inevitably loses focus while doing so. So that's a wasted feature.In contrast, you cannot zoom on the Canon while shooting, but you can pre-zoom before hitting the record button. This trade-off in my opinion, is worth the far better video quality of the Canon. The color is true and there is a lot less noise and graininess than the Panasonic. Just make sure you disable the digital zoom.Don't expect miracles for video from any still camera. My only expectation was respectable video quality under optimal (i.e. daylight) conditions. No still camera will ever replace my HF200 as a camcorder, but for spontaneous daylight clips, this camera is great to have in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Dual View Finders Makes this a Plus
Reviews.Author: George F. Phares "G. Phares"
Reviews.Content: Most point and shoot cameras have eliminated the ability to look thru the view finder when shooting the picture. Regardless of how well the image stabilization software works, it is still difficult to get a sharp picture when you have to hold the camera in front of you.  The Canon PowerShot SD780IS gives the user the choice between the large, well-lit LCD or the traditional viewfinder.The controls are easy to identify and use and the battery life appears to be quite satisfactory. Picture quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: A great pocket camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Nick "whereishawkins"
Reviews.Content: One of the problems with writing camera reviews is that people never consider the "space" which this camera occupies in the market. For example, I know that a $200 point and shoot camera will never take as awesome photos as my $3500 digital SLR, or even as my Powershot G10. But at the same time, I'm not going to go out on a night of drinking with my friends and bring a digital SLR because a) it's expensive and b) bulky.Having said that, I'm really impressed at the output of the pictures. At the default high resolution JPG, I was blown away at how crisp the images were. At higher ISOs, the photos became progressively noisier - but that's a problem that's common among most point and shoot cameras. I'm not too worried - again, this is a camera I'm taking out and about and taking snapshots, not trying to be Annie Liebovitz. Prints at 8x10 look fine.The 720p video is rather slick - even while goofing around taking videos, the videos were of decent enough quality that I'd be happy posting them to YouTube or Facebook. And no "rolling shutter', which is kind of cool. I'd recommend getting a Class 6 SDHC card for the camera, so it'll write the HD video fast enough to the camera without having to deal with dropping video. The optical zoom doesn't work in video mode, but digital zoom does. Digital zoom, in my experience, generally leads to awful photos and videos, so I try to avoid it all costs.The SD780 is easy to operate, and there's virtually zero learning curve if you have experience with other Canon cameras.One of the common complaints is that the camera's casing will attract dings, scratches and other things that will keep your camera looking less than pristine. If you're going to be buying this camera, you're better off spending $25 extra to get the Invisible Shield cover for this camera.For under $250, this camera is great. It's smaller than my Blackberry and wallet, and makes up deficiencies by being a petite camera that fits in virtually any pocket.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Rotte
Reviews.Content: Easy to carry in your pocket. Image stabilization works well.  Just finished two week vacation and batteries still have 3/4 charge.Purchased the underwater housing for this camera and it is working great.  I use the underwater setting and don't need any filters.  Added bonus that the camera already has settings up for scuba diving.Have also acquired a strobe, which has improved my pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera. Look no further.
Reviews.Author: Michael Castagnetti
Reviews.Content: The camera is as thin as they get. It takes HD video and great pictures. It does not come wth a sd card so I recommend to get a large capacity SD card because of the enormous space HD takes (32GB is as high as you can get it, 8 Gb would be fine)

Reviews.Title: Perfect size and weight. Awesome photos.
Reviews.Author: Joel B. Hecht
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take photos on a trip to Argentina a Uruguay. I wanted something I could take everywhere, easily and fit in my pocket. The SD780IS was perfect for that. It's almost as thin as my iPhone and I couldn't be happier with the quality of pics it took. Easy to learn to you, very small and convenient, beautifully designed. It turned out to be exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: This is an amazing camera in a small package
Reviews.Author: Ran Borgersen
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon before this one that I loved, and was not happy when it died after a drop.  Then I got this one...and love it more.Positives:- Versatile--great photos in a variety of conditions- Good video- Compact- Fast--takes pictures relatively quickly and stores them very fast- Overall excellent picture quality- Many others I probably do not realize, since I was spoiled by my last Canon, which was a generation or two earlier version of this one.Negatives- Would have liked more optical zoom, but realized it was a sacrifice for size.- Colored cases show every scratch and ding--I wish had got a sliver one instead of a black oneHave you every had a pair of shoes that you loved because they were comfortable and looked great and found that you wore them everywhere until you wore them out or could not resole them again?  Well, this is the camera version of those shoes.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: YK
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and immediately took it on a two week trip in Europe where I got to use it both indoor and outdoor.The main reason I bought it was to have the ability to take decent pictures with a camera that fits in side pocket of my jeans.I was not disappointed at all. The pictures came out well, the camera feels solidly built, with intuitive menus and easy access to features.The videos are decent even when shot in lower res mode.My only complaint really is that the little switch that controls whether the camera is in auto/pro/video mode changes position pretty easily if you put the camera in a pocket, so one needs to be careful to check that the camera is in the right mode.Overall: very good.

Reviews.Title: My review for Canon PowerShot SD780IS
Reviews.Author: Salie Howell
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the best camera out there. It takes such clear pictures & the HD video is a plus. The only down fall i have on this camera is the buttons. They are extrememly small & sometimes hard to use. I have big hands but i manage well.  Other then that i give this camera 5 stars. I love this camera. It is definitely worth the price. If you are looking for a little camera that takes extremely clear pictures & videos buy it. By the way i am 18 yrs old & my name is Salie. I am using my dads account to write this.

Reviews.Title: Only 1 word - Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations from this camera. Great reviews, great brand name, 12 MP, HD video recording, HDMI etc...so many features but I'm disappointed at the results of this camera.Not sure if it is the piece I received, but the quality of pictures and video is very bad. The video was very grainy...the pictures didn't live up to the expectations. My old 4MP Nikon coolpix did a better job than this. There are not many cameras out there for ~ $220 which have all these features, so I chose this camera. Returned it after a week of use. Tried in various surroundings - indoor, outdoor, hd video etc...nothing is good.1 star to camera. 5 stars to Amazon for promptly processing the refund.

Reviews.Title: Canon's Customer dis-service is horrible!!
Reviews.Author: MarkV
Reviews.Content: This camera really never took great or even good pictures.  Main thing I am reviewing is Canon's customer service.  I think it is the worst customer service I have ever dealt with. I bought this camera 5 or 6 months ago, my wife dropped it (very easy drop) and the camera kept saying "lens error".  Sent it in for repair and received email stating that it was damaged and will cost 129.70 to repair.  I purchased this camera for 176.00 and extra batteries and accessories for another 50.00.  They wouldn't help me out at all.. I called and they were rude and unresponsive.  I am stuck with a dead POS after 5 months. Thanks Canon.  I have purchased many Canon products but, will no longer buy anything with Canon on it.

Reviews.Title: Great budget camera.
Reviews.Author: Tombom "F#A#Infinity"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my school's local senior project intending to shoot a short film with this. The features are great and it takes video and camera excellently but there are probably better cameras you can get.

Reviews.Title: Great investment
Reviews.Author: niallrr
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Dec 2010. Since then to now, Jan 2013, I have learned, experimented, and improved my photography methods with this camera. First thing, this camera can take some stunning photos, however, just like with any camera, you have to setup angle, lighting, and focus right or it won't be worth anything. It captures images at 3000x4000 pixels (which if you do not know, that is a fairly huge photo). The video is at 720p and it works just fine like that! The only downside to the video is that I do not believe the focus can be changed while it is recording (I say I do not believe because after 2 years, I am still learning how to fine tune the camera to maximize performance). I'm currently looking into buying an extra battery because I like taking a lot of videos (which does wear a little heavy on the battery if you're out shooting for several hours). But, if you're someone who just likes taking pictures, you can snap all day. For fun and battery saving, I like to turn off the LCD and shoot images through the eyehole (or whatever it is called, haha). Another thing, this camera is SMALL. People will not tend to believe you that you are able to produce such wonderful images with something of this size. The benefit of the size is that it can always go with you and it won't fill up your pocket as much as an iPhone or something of that size. I do recommend to ALWAYS use the wrist strap when shooting with this bad boy because its size does make it prone to fall out of your hand!I have taken this camera up and down the East Coast of the United States and Western Europe, might I say, I have yet to be disappointed. I am fully able to replace this camera with a DSLR or even a compact DSLR, but I realized that I would miss out on my pocket portability that allowed me to capture those "moments" only when the time was of the essence.If anything, I truly love this device and would recommend this for someone who wants to capture the world with something that can fit in a pocket.My God, I truly do love this device. Thank you Canon. Seriously. I have captured a lot of moments that are now remembered with the fine detail captured by this device. Thank you.EDIT: 19 July 2013I still love this device. After taking it around the United States and Europe on numerous occasions, it seems to be my only friend.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Carol W.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much that when the one I had broke (I dropped it once too often), I didn't hesitate to buy another one.  Small, convenient, excellent pictures and videos, just an all around good camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Small/Light But Powerful Camera
Reviews.Author: Marcellus
Reviews.Content: The camera is extremely small and light which I like a lot.  The camera takes excellent pictures.  If you have big hands or big fingers, you may not like this camera.  As for me, it is perfect.  I hate bulky cameras.

Reviews.Title: Got It Used
Reviews.Author: Caroline Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Works just fine. Lost my old one and loved it so much that I wanted the same one. Unfortunately I couldn't afford a new one. This one works just as well.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Seller & Great Product
Reviews.Author: M. TRIMM
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to take a minute to write an incredible review for you. I had to send you an email and you responded immediately to my question. Thank you. The camera was a gift for my fiancee and she absolutely loves it. It's tiny tiny tiny (in a very good way). It turns on almost instantly and it takes incredible photos for being such a small portable camera. She is happy to be rejoined with her beloved Elph camera. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera SD780IS
Reviews.Author: SMMJ
Reviews.Content: Camera was advertised as new but arrived in a packaging that was open and damaged.  Contents were complete and camera works fine.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Steve Vrana
Reviews.Content: As a high school yearbook adviser, I have literally bought dozens of Canon cameras from Amazon over the past decade. I purchased two of these for those occasions where ease of transporting was a key consideration. Students taking them on a band trip, to an FBLA convention, or a speech meet. This camera is small enough to easily fit into a shirt pocket. And best of all, it takes excellent photos.Also, each summer I take this camera along with me on my week-long bicycle trip. I put it in a plastic bag, it goes in by jersey pocket, and I have instant access to pictures all day long.No camera is perfect, but it is difficult not to take great pictures with this amazing little camera. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera!
Reviews.Author: crazy4beardies
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a couple of years ago and love it! I still use it and the pictures are crisp and clear, as well as the colors being vibrant! Love Canon! Would buy again..

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tweetly's Beauty
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 3yrs now and it still works great.Picture quality is still wonderfull.Will buy it again if i need another Camera

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera-Love it
Reviews.Author: fhowell2
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a good small camera with a view finder. This fit the bill and she is very happy with the photo quality and ease of handling. There is a slight learning curve moving around all the menus, but it is mostly intuitive. All of our cameras use SD cards, nothing proprietary and the battery charges quickly. I am also very happy with the ease of purchase at Amazon-one click.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Zulmira Salazar
Reviews.Content: I love to take pictures of everything... so this camera is perfect for me! Easy and fast! So damn good! Merry Christmas!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Irwin
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this camera through Amazon. I bought this at Walmart when it was on sale for $120 which was a steal. I use a 16G SD card which gives about 90 minutes of video recording in 720HD mode, and about 4 hours in standard. This camera takes gorgeous pictures and video. There are many lighting and color options. It takes video fairly well in low lighting. This camera is a  beautifully constructed work of art, and feels good to hold in your hands. There are two drawbacks for this camera. While it does have quality metal construction, if it were to fall onto concrete I believe it might break. Especially with the lens out. I always make sure I use the wrist strap when I am outdoors. The other drawback is the lack of zoom when filming video. The digital zoom can be used while recording but greatly reduces video quality. All other settings must be set before you start shooting video. This camera takes great pictures, and amazing video. It has a macro video mode which allows you to record things close up! I filmed a honey bee on a flower in macro mode and it captured amazing details I could not see with the naked eye. Excellent for macro video! If you are considering buying one, go to Youtube and look at all the video people made with this camera. You will be impressed! I would buy this camera again if I could find a good deal on it. This is my main camera that I use with the exception of my smartphone. This camera takes superior pictures and videos to my phone, or any other camera I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: A great point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: egad
Reviews.Content: I am into photography and take a lot of photos with my digital SLR. However, there are times that I don't feel like lugging that camera around, so I got this camera. The size of this camera is fantastic! As a female, I like that I can actually slip it in the pocket of my jeans. You can't do that with most p&s; because they are too bulky.The camera takes fantastic photos and has a good amount of manual options for a point and shoot. The colors that is captures are quite impressive. One of my favorite manual settings is the macro setting. This camera takes really good macro shots.My one negative about this camera and you are going to get this pretty much with any p&s; is the delay between when you click the button and when the photo is taken.

Reviews.Title: The Bee's Knees
Reviews.Author: Peter D "pdesil"
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this camera I was expecting a mid grade Canon camera that took decent but superior images. What I got instead blew my mind. This camera has a really vivid and crisp image. The images are always stable and It it has amazing Macro ability. I have taken pictures of everything from an eye to a leaf and the pictures always come out with amazing detail. There is some problem with low light shots but what can you expect you are only paying minimal for what you are getting. Take this camera to a Picnic, The Beach, Pool Party, Soccer Game, or any other family even and you will come home with some of the best looking memories you can get short of a Canon Rebel. One thing I suggest though if you plan on taking video in 720p is that you get a higher class SD card i recommend. Transcend 16 GB SDHC Class 10 Flash Memory Card TS16GSDHC10E Most memory and and adequate class for you price. I have a Transcend Memory card and I have never had any problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, dependable, and durable
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have always loved my cannon camera - I had an older version of this one and it lasted for 2 overseas trips (during the last one, I managed to crack the screen really bad when I fell on it :/  ), but it still worked for months after that.  It finally succumbed to the desert sands and torture I had put it through by carrying it with me everywhere (either by pocket or back pack)on the last week of my trip.  I purchased this camera for myself as a Christmas present and could not be happier -  I love the features (color accent, settings for different scenes)and it makes great videos.  I make sure I keep this one in its case and out of my cargo pockets so that it will be around for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera; so sad it finally died
Reviews.Author: hbphd "hbphd"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much research two Novembers ago.  My main criteria were 1) it had to be VERY small; 2) it needed to take great still shots with high resolution; 3) I wanted HD video.1  This camera, is, indeed, VERY small.  So small that my little fingers have a hard time with the buttons sometimes.  This has not been too much of an issue, as I am now used to it.  The small size is a huge asset.2  I have received THOUSANDS of compliments on the photos I've taken with this camera.  Without editing, or with very simple cropping and retouching, this camera delivers high-quality photos, even set at medium resolution.  The number of settings give excellent functionality for all levels of photographers.  If you want a highly functional SMALL camera that takes great photos, this is it.3  The HD video is also really good but it takes up a lot of space on the memory card and takes a long time to upload anywhere.  I've used the next grade down and had fine results taking videos of sports events.Other plusses:  Battery life is amazing.Minuses:  over time, this camera has acted strange at times, especially with the opening and closing of the lens and with time between pressing the button and the flash activating.  While a simple "restore factory settings" usually got it back on track, this dysfunction was unsettling when I was in once in a lifetime situations I HAD to memorialize in photos.Finally, after probably 10,000 photos on the beach and in other grimy, humid conditions, the lens refuses to open all the way when I turn the camera on.  This problem can be fixed, but I'm being told that the fix will cost more than a new, better camera.  I'm bummed even though I think I've probably used this camera to death.Great camera.  Too bad all our electronics now come with built-in obsolescence.

Reviews.Title: poor construction
Reviews.Author: Mom
Reviews.Content: This camera is very flimsy in construction.  I got this camera as a Christmas present a year ago. I am just a point and shoot photographer and the simpler the camera the better I am at using it.  This camera has poor battery life when taking video.  The pictures were not any better than my old Casio. Canon  Camera is not user friendly with all the different menus  and if you accidentally pressed the wrong button by the time you figured out how to correct it the shot was gone.  The worst thing is after awhile the lens did not work and "lens error" kept being displayed .  Canon service is not very good at helping to fix the problem.  Definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: takes great pictures, but seems to drain batteries
Reviews.Author: "love to cook"
Reviews.Content: This camera is slim and takes a great picture. However, it seems to drain batteries if you leave the battery in the camera. We thought the battery was bad. So, we ordered another battery. The same thing happens. So, we have to constantly remove the battery when the camera is not in use. We now have two batteries, which helps if we find ourselves with a dead one.

Reviews.Title: Ok pics, but dark spots on my photos
Reviews.Author: Scott J. Sherratt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in December, 2009.  It is susceptible to particles getting inside and settling on the optics such that dark spots show up on some of my pictures.  This happened after owning the camera for 3 months.  I sent it back, and the problem was corrected.  It happened again this week  (the camera is now out of warranty).  I take good care of my cameras and have always kept this one in a case.  I bought an inert air duster and shot air around the lens as the Canon service rep in Virginia recommended.  No improvement.  Canon wants $119 plus tax & shipping and 2 weeks to clean the dust off.  When it works and doesn't have black blobs on my pictures, it works well and takes nice pictures.  However this recurring dust problem and the lack of reasonable options for cleaning will make this camera my last purchase from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error, un usable after 1.5 years
Reviews.Author: Ulises Gamiz "ugamiz"
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the features of this Camera, until I started getting a 'Lens Error, restart Camara' error every time i wanted to turn it on, is a shame i paid more than 200dlls for something that does not last. I look over the internet for the error and found I was not only one having it. I tried several fixes recommended but still not working. I am not sure if would buy Canon again I am very disapointed

Reviews.Title: Lens error 1 week after warranty expired
Reviews.Author: Cay Horstmann
Reviews.Content: After 1 year and 1 week, promptly after warranty expiration, I too get the dreaded lens error. One must admire Canon for its amazing timing, but the sad fact remains that I can now junk this thing.

Reviews.Title: Good camera - not amazing
Reviews.Author: M. Simon
Reviews.Content: I wanted a name-brand camera for less than $200 that would be easy to use, have image stabilization, and shoot video. This one is as I hoped - starts up quickly, is fairly easy to select a picture mode, and durable, with a few downsides:- it doesn't always shoot the picture with the right lighting, even when I have it on the right setting or even auto- similar to this, it takes much better photos of people with light complexions than darker tones, no matter what setting you put it on- the video recorder has terrible audio capabilitiesNext time, I might just spend the extra $50 to get something a little "higher" end.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly good image quality from a "spy" camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel S. Glickman
Reviews.Content: I have a Lumix LX-3 for creative photography.  It is a superb camera, but it does not fit in a jeans pocket, so I decided to get a SD780 as it is absolutely tiny, much smaller than my cell phone or my wallet.  And as the saying goes, the best camera is the one you have with you!For its size, the SD780 takes excellent images.  I use it on full automatic setting as a point and shoot, and while the image quality is not quite up to LX-3 standards, it is pretty amazing.I recently was on Amelia Island and took a bicycle ride to the salt marsh.  I slipped the SD780 in my pocket (I can take this camera everywhere and anywhere since it is so tiny) and ended up taking a photo of the salt marsh that was so good, I had it enlarged and framed and hung up on my wall.  I am very, very picky about my photography and I never thought I would frame and hang an image taken from such a tiny camera.  The folks at the camera store could not believe this image came from the SD780.  So it has the capability of taking amazingly good images.Battery life is exceptional, much better than my LX-3.  I've had the SD780 for a year now, and the only issue is it sometimes makes some odd noises, but I am thinking this is related to the battery getting low.  At least I hope that is the reason!

Reviews.Title: Great for 1 year
Reviews.Author: J. Murphy "Clean Freak"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for Christmas 2009. It worked perfectly for 1 year. Great photos, good video, long battery life, and super easy to use. After having the camera for 1 year I started to have a problem. The lens cover won't open when I turn the camera on. I have to turn the camera on and off multiple times or I have to use my finger to force it open. I have never dropped the camera or mishandled it. It is usually on a shelf away from my toddler's hands. It continues to take great photos, but this was very disappointing. Buyer be ware.

Reviews.Title: My Awesome Canon Elph
Reviews.Author: J. Casale "Judi C"
Reviews.Content: All I can say is I love my new little Canon SD780IS.  It is smaller than my cell phone but takes the best pictures.  I have an old Canon Elph that uses Advantix Film and I loved that one, but this is the one that I have been waiting for.  The camera has so many great features that you can fix a shot once you have taken it, crop it, change the color, etc.  I was looking for a camera with a view finder, one that was easy to use and has a lot of great features and one that did not cost me a lot of money.  This is the best for me, not only does it have a view finder, but the LCD screed is really clear and easy to see.  I have a Kodak 14mp from QVC and I totally hate it!  I cannot see in the view finder, the photos never come out they are always out of focus.This is THE camera for me since I just take casual shots and am not a professional photographer.  The directions are easy to read, I just love this camera and carry it everywhere.  And the best part of this was that I ordered it on Dec. 22nd. The next day there was a door tag from Fed Ex and I picked it up on Christmas eve just in time to enjoy it for Christmas.I really love this camera and the color Red is my favorite color.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Drumm Jr. "GLD"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this little camera.  It takes fantastic pictures, is extremely easy to use, and has all of the right features for a "point and shoot" digital camera system.  In my opnion this is perfect for quick family photos at events such as Christmas, New Year's, Thankgiving, 4th of July, etc.  I also love it's small form factor, making it easy to carry in your front pocket.  It also take excellent video.  The only thing I wish they'd added is an AC adapter so I can plug it into the wall when doing videos, but nothing a second battery can't cover for most situations.  If you're looking for a nice, small, easy-to-use digital camera with GREA quality pictures, this thing is an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera
Reviews.Author: McCoffeeDad
Reviews.Content: We've been using our new Canon PowerShot SD780IS camera for four or five months now and couldn't be happier.  I can report no problems or issues so far, and the photo quality and video quality is great.  I am impressed with the battery life of this camera, and the feature set is great.  This is a great camera for the price, and I recommend it as a family/college/all-around workhorse digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this Camera
Reviews.Author: sharron
Reviews.Content: This is a small but fun camera I like it alot takes pictures quick. easy downloads and picture quality very good.

Reviews.Title: small cute
Reviews.Author: STUDENT
Reviews.Content: cam is lovely, small cute...just get the box/case for it ..don t let it get scratched ;)my friend loveed it

Reviews.Title: Perfect light weight camera
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my old digital for tramping and biking the South Island of New Zealand. I could not have made a better selection. I like the viewfinder feature for bright-light shots and the ability to to turn off the view screen to save battery. The battery is very important on long trips thu the rain forests of the west coast where you can be away from a charger for a week and a half or more. Its light weight and small size means I can carry it in a small zip-loc baggy in my shirt pocket ready for almost instant use. The picture quality is fine for the type of photos I take which are basic snapshots of friends and views. Very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a small camera for the wife and it needed to be simple but good quality. This camera appeared to fit the bill. After almost a year, I can say that it has exceeded all of our expectations. It takes excellent photos, much better than our comparable Nikon (which I never liked). The battery holds a charge a long time, and the features are easy to use. Overall it's a great little camera. The zoom could be better, but for a camera this size, it is just fine. The camera has a viewfinder, so you can use this without the viewer on the back to save battery power, in which case the battery will last for hundreds of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but be aware of video format
Reviews.Author: g00n
Reviews.Content: Nice camera but for people who do a lot of video shooting and have a PC with Windows you should be aware that you may have significant trouble editing. I am guessing that if you have a Mac it will not be a problem. You can not use a simple editing program such as windows movie maker in my experience. There is a very basic movie edit option in the ZoomBrowser EX software that came with the camera but I don't think most people would find that it is satisfactory. The movies are in a quicktime format and in my case a search for expensive editing software became necessary. I wasted time trying many free programs with no success. I also tried numerous methods of movie type conversions with no real success. I finally ending up buying Sony Vegas movie studio HD editing software which was about the cheapest option I could find that would work for editing video I took with this camera.If you are going to use the camera for regular video shooting I would recommend buying a cheap aftermarket backup battery.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: Great form factor (small, sleek), beautiful HD video, great low-light pictures. This camera is really the full package for the average camera user (obviously, if you're pro or obsessed with cameras you need to get like the Nikon D700). But even one of my pro friends was impressed and was like "where did you get that, I want one!" I have the red version and bought a second black one as a gift, also from Amazon. Shipping was on time and condition was new from Pavillion electronics. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Katie A Hard
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned. For what I need it's perfect. I am a student at university and just needed a camera to record some moments of football games and times with friends. This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures and is available at a great price. For a good, decently priced, and easy to use camera I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: A. R. Kushmir "Kush"
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these for my wife, I have Canon Rebel XT for myself, but I found that I was borrowing her little camera more and more it's so convenient and easy to use and I didn't have to lug a bag around, did I mention the fantastic quality of the photos? The Rebel XT is a wonderful camera and I use it and depend on it a lot, but I can't slide it into my shirt pocket for those, "just in case" shots that I use to miss. I was fortunate and got a good deal on a refurbished one, but it would have been worth the list price. Thanks Amazon and Canon.

Reviews.Title: Amazing features in a tiny little package
Reviews.Author: J. Navarro
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera!! It's a replacement for a Canon PS A630 which I also really loved. Canon is a great brand. Don't let the tiny size fool you, this camera packs a big punch!  The flash is amazing...works so well.  Lots of times when I grab a stranger and ask them to take a picture for me they'll respond with something like "wow, this takes great pictures!" They don't expect it from such a small camera. I LOVE having the tiny size that can fit in the pockets of my tight jeans so comfortably, too. =)  I love the HD movie feature!  The sound works great (it seems like I'd seen bad reviews about that, but I haven't noticed any problems at all).  It doesn't have a few features that my old one had, like manual focus and being able to adjust the amount of flash, and of course the flip out LCD screen the A630 had (I REALLY wish Canon would include that in more cameras--I LOVED that!) but it's a small price to pay.  This camera takes excellent pictures with vivid colors.  The start up time is fast, time between pictures is fine.  I wish the battery lasted a little longer, but extra batteries in an off brand are cheap (I bought one here on Amazon for around $6) so I just keep a charged one handy in my purse or camera case.  I like that it comes in red, my favorite color. =)  I'm a big fan of this camera and am incredibly happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Ankit Mangal
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. I am not a professional photographer. I found it very easy to use. Great picture quality, HD videos and small enough to fit into my jeans pocket. .

Reviews.Title: Great Photos! Love it!
Reviews.Author: Christine Alexander "Christine Alexander"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that was easy and just took nice looking photos. I had a Nikon and my photos where always blurry, and just not great photos. Needing to take good photos for a few events I was having, I sought out to find a better camera and bought this one. It is fantastic. Just point and shoot - great photos. Yesterday I took shots of people plying tennis and with the automatic mode they where clear action shots.Best camera I have ever owned - highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: J. R. Nixon
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for almost a year now with the main purpose of documenting our child's little miracles. I'm used to using a professional Nikon SLR at my job, but I've been pleasantly surprised with the quality of pictures made by this point and shoot. The interface is fairly standard for a camera of this type and has the features you'd expect. I'd appreciate a little more control over the focus feature with auto-macro recognition. As always the zoom could be more, but there's only so much room for a camera this small. That's really the biggest perk for this camera, it's size. You could fit this in your pants pocket easily, which is great b/c it's one less thing I have to lug in a baby bag. Light-weight and powerful, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Tisha Robinson
Reviews.Content: I am fan of Canon PowerShot series. i started using these cameras over 3 years ago. They do break up after some heavy usage, but I stay with them anyway. They are smallest cameras that produce nearly professional looking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but don't forget to separately order a memory card when buying the camera
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Lenhart
Reviews.Content: September 11, 2010Great camera (purchase price: $159.00 in August 2010) and company. The only thing I wish was that the Amazon listing made it clear that the camera did not come with a memory card and, thus, the camera was not ready to take photos when I received it. After receiving my camera, I gave another look at the ad and it did say "Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)." So I'm supposed to know what "SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus" means? I do now.As my new $159 paperweight sat, I then ordered the following memory card for $34.24 (per another commentator's recommendation):Sandisk 8GB EXTREME SDHC HD Video Card Class 6 - 20MB/s (SDSDRX3-8192) [Hassle-Free Packaging].It's all good now, but make sure that you order a memory card (8 Gigabytes (GB) or more) WITH your camera order.March 12, 2011Camera still working excelent. Another item you should order along with the Sandisk Video Card is the "Universal Camera Case for Canon Powershot AS850, SD1100, SD1000, SD870, SD880, SD790, SD770, SD750, SD780, SD980 IS, SD940 IS and Many More" $4.46 . No camera case comes with the camera and the case is important for keeping your Canon camera free from scratches.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: Loves Reading "Liz"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and received it (two days later) the day we were leaving for a 3 week drive from Texas to the West Coast. No time to read the instructions, but turns out it is very intuitive and easily figured out. It worked like a champ, staying charged forever, taking beautiful clear pictures in any light. Not super fast, but much better than my old fuji (that I really liked).  My husband has an SLR and I had my tiny Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Deep Red). Mine was so compact and reliable, we used it the most.  Holds 8gig memory card and was easy to download to my netbook using a cardreader.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot - Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago and have enjoyed the ease of use and clarity of photos since the 1st shot.  Takes great dog pics and puppy pics.  Also does an excellent job to document my weavings before they are sold.  I'm lovin' this piece of equipment.  I had to charge the battery yesterday (1 month on a charge is NOT bad)!1 Warped Weaver

Reviews.Title: Great Choice
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I've owned two cameras prior to this canon (a kodak & an olympus) and this is by far my favorite.  Even though it wasn't the most important factor for me, the small size is a definite plus.  I've used it for an entire day without having low battery although I do think charging nightly is a good idea if you use it quite a bit.  The picture quality overall is great. Yes, it takes a blurry picture from time to time, but if you set the camera correctly (its really easy to do) your pictures will turn out great.  I use this camera for facebook/internet use and for printing normal size photos & find it works very well! And an added bonus - its actually a pretty tough camera.  The first week I had it, it was COMPLETELY submerged underwater for 5 minutes (turned off) and after about a week of drying out, it works perfectly. I can barely believe it & it makes me love it that much more.  I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tanya C. M.
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this camera.  It's easy to use, it's conveniently tiny, the pictures are clear and taking video is easy also.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot - does what I ask
Reviews.Author: T. Lower
Reviews.Content: This camera has more functions than I know about I am sure. I just turn it on, point it at what I want and take a picture. They usually turn out great and if they don't it is probably my fault, and that is the only reason I am giving it 4 stars. Sometimes it would be nice for these cameras to be idiot proof so that they still take great pictures when you just point and shoot, but they take even better pictures when you actually know how to use the camera properly and utilize all the fancy settings and functions. Some of us don't know how to trick out the F-stops, etc and we truly want the camera to do it ALL for us. :-)But for the most part I'd say 95% of my pictures come out great. I got this camera after a trip to Costa Rica. My friend had a snappy Canon and every time we saw a great picture opportunity my old camera took forever to come to life and I was missing pictures while hers was up and shooting away. I did a lot of research on the Internet and decided on SD780IS, not only for its start up speed but for its other features, which I am slowly learning how to use.I am no longer missing photo opportunities. It is also small enough that I carry it the tiniest of purses, or even my back pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great portability, easy to use, has a view finder
Reviews.Author: Peggy Fereday
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for a small camera to take on hiking trips that I could carry in a shirt pocket. This little camera is just what I needed. It's compact, has a view finder, though small, for using in bright sun light. The screens on every camera I've had washed out in bright sun light. Takes great pictures and videos. I carry this in my purse all the time. The battery charger is also small and easily carried in my purse. I am glad I bought this little gem.

Reviews.Title: Nice ultra-portable
Reviews.Author: acatalan
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month now. It was a replacement for my A590IS. I have to say I was skeptical about the quality of the pictures because of the extremely small size. But bought it anyway because it is a Canon, very small, and it has 720p video recording.I am back from a week off and now that I see the pictures I am surprised with the quality, the colors. Of course it is still a compact so do not expect DSLR like pics. The video quality and sharpness is pretty good too. The battery life was a surprise too, over 250 pics per charge (I bought a backup battery too, I recommend it if you take around 200 pics per day when on vacation).Overall a very good camera, very small and compact. Good thing is that its price is low because it is not the newest model.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mom in Virginia
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Canon PowerShot SD780IS camera for our teenage daughter to replace an unreliable Samsung which ate batteries.  I have a Canon A95 and have really enjoy it, so we thought we would give this one a try.  She has had it for 3 months at the writing of this review. It is everything it claims to be and more.The battery life is amazing!  We bought her an extra battery based on the experience we had with her finicky Samsung.  So far she has never needed the spare battery.  She loves the fact that it is small and fits into her purse.  She took it to the Otakon Convention in Baltimore, on a trip to Chicago and Minneapolis and it took fabulous photos each time under lots of different conditions.It is petite and works well for people with small fingers. Most men may find this camera difficult to use due to its small button size.  However, I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone looking for a good quality camera and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: not as good quality as I expected
Reviews.Author: Brenda R
Reviews.Content: I have had Canon point and shoots for years.  I got this one, and I am having difficulty with blurriness.  I would like to return it, but I was out of town and didn't get it done.  Overall disappointed in the quality of my pictures.  When set on Automatic it takes forever to focus and shoot.  I am a true amateur.  To use this camera and get quality pictures I am going to have to up my knowledge of all the settings.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS
Reviews.Author: K. George
Reviews.Content: This is our second Canon PowerShot and we love them. Never any problems, takes great pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Just when you think they can't make it any smaller!
Reviews.Author: C. Chu "Phil"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera (SD780IS) because my son broke my SD600. When I got the SD780 IS, I was amazed that this camera is even smaller or I should say thinner than my SD600. SD780 is about 20% thinner than SD600. However, SD600 feels sturdier than the SD780 IS. The only 2 features that SD780 tops SD600 are the HD video/audio and higher resolution. I think the picture quality for both model is about the same. Also SD600 is made in Japan where as SD780 is made in China. If you don't care about the HD video/audio, I would definitely recommend SD600 as a better buy.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Yet
Reviews.Author: RunningK
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of canon cameras. I have found this one is much better then previous models, with improved speed and picture quality. The hd video is truely amazing and all the pictures come out stunning. Every picture comes out clear too. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jags Fan
Reviews.Content: THis small camera is powerful to take vivid photo and video.  Just simply amazing.  It's simple to operate.  Truly point and shoot! and the result after to upload it to your computer is just fantastic.  When I viewed my photos I was just amazed how clear and vivid my photos are.  The videos are the same, the HD is just as clear as much as today's HD camcorders.  I would recommend this to your love ones and teens would love this. Check this out.[...]

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot 780
Reviews.Author: MattPH
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It sure beats having to use film camera, having to get it developed, and then scanning.  I like to upload photos on my computer and then put them on facebook.  I like the uses that it has.  It allows me to create black and white photos as well as do some cool timer shots.  I did that on Saturday.  My one concern is once I download the pictures to a computer I can't download them again to another computer.  I fortunately know how to make CDs and that is definitely easier than emailing.  I like the fact that is small that it is like carrying a cellphone.  I like that I am able to do videos but I cannot email them or download them to facebook that I know of.  I would recommend the warranty in case the camera is dropped or gets damaged in shipping.

Reviews.Title: Best camera to date!
Reviews.Author: Bay Breeze
Reviews.Content: In September of 09 I purchased this camera for my son, from Amazon.com, for $225.20, with an extra battery, and free shipping & handling. I knew it was a good buy, so I ordered one for myself.  I still use my older Canon cameras but this one has a sharper image and if you take snaps while driving...they couldn't be any sharper. Note: the size is just a little slimmer than older models. My orders were for the Gold...what a buy.  Thank you Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Fydly "bookworm"
Reviews.Content: I had a 6 year old camera (also Canon) that I recently gave to my dad who seemed interested in taking digital pictures and  I started looking for a new digital camera.SD780IS was recommended highly and the selling point for me was the availability of a view finder as it is very hard to see what you are aiming at in bright daylight without a viewfinder.I already have countless pictures in different environments from hot hazy days on the sea to some flowers I have that bloom only once a year (and only for a day) in all occasions the results turned out great. Clarity, picture quality it is all there.The size of the camera is perfect, I have a red one I love its color and using it (charging the battery or downloading the pics) is so easy.I must mention that for this price it is the best deal.

Reviews.Title: Canon Easy
Reviews.Author: GCC
Reviews.Content: Could not recommend this product enough. For the money spent and what the camera is(a compact, pocket camera), it is outstanding. I purchased two of them and no complaints. One of the recent purchases got to go to Europe and preformed very well and made my wife very happy (picture taking nut). What more could you ask...

Reviews.Title: Aesthetically pleasing
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: It's a nice camera. The picture quality is phenomenal. However, when I shoot pictures at night especially lights, the pictures come out blurry. The camera says that my hand is shaking (which it is not). I'm still an amateur when it comes to picture taking and dealing with camera technology so maybe it's something I did wrong. Perhaps I should read the manual and try out everything. But overall, the quality of the pictures is excellent and even made my friend who likes taking pictures very jealous.

Reviews.Title: Disposable point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I don't know what is happening to all of the major brands we knew and trusted....I purchased this camera to replace a 5 yr old 5 mp Olympus 5050 that was broken at my wife's friend's bridal shower- (she left it at the table to go to the restroom and when she came back, she found 3 batteries sitting next to the camera, and 1 on the floor, she tried to put the batteries back in and door would not lock down..noone said anything to her.)
