I think the digital zoom is okay but then it's not always good on any point and shoot.Video review:1) Great video. It outputs in 720P HD quality. Nice look and feel when viewing on a computer or on tv. HDMI port is a bonus on the camera.2) Only drawback is you can't optically zoom while filming. But then think about the size of the camera - so plan your shots accordingly before filming. You'll get good video clips for the web to share. Not going to produce an oscar-winning film with this :)Overall:What else can I or anyone else say? Great camera for all the features offered for $220. I love the color, red, too. Nice to have a different color than the same old silver or black boring colors.If you are curious about the quality of pictures or video, go to Vimeo or Flicr and do search for SD780. It should be enough to convince you to buy this.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Small Camera That Takes Great Shots!
Reviews.Author: rk2000
Reviews.Content: My first priority was a small camera.  I figure the smaller it is, the more likely I'd be to carry it with me, even if it didn't take the best shots in the world.  I did a lot of research and this was the camera that consistently got the best reviews.  AND it takes great photos, so I feel like I didn't need to compromise at all!The red color is really sharp.  I was leaning towards the Sony T77 since it was cool looking, but that thing is a fingerprint trap.  The Canon UI is really easy to use, time to power on and take a shot is very fast, images stabilization works well, shoots HD video, doesn't use that silly proprietary Sony format - it's got everything I need!  Only improvement I might like is a bigger screen, but I'm not sure how you would fit it on such a small camera.  Very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera, Small and Good Quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is nice and small, cool looking, very easy to use, and produces nice (albeit not perfect - thus the 4) results.  I'm very happy with the price/quality ratio.My only negative points would be that the color is a bit off (colors a little louder than real life), and zooming in doesn't get what I would think this many Megapixels would.  Oh yeah, and the recorded bits are humongous.  I just ran it through a free program, WinFF and was able to reduce the size very nicely.  The problematic parameter was the bitrate.  I changed it from 20Mb/s to 1Mb/s.  It would be nice if the camera had an option to do this internally.That said, those are really picky points and its a great deal for the money.  I really just love it's small form factor because I can throw it in my pocket and not feel like I'm encumbered, yet it takes good quality pics easily!Update: I know this is years later, but a few years back (after I'd owned it for several) I lost it while out enjoying some recent snow.  A month later (after the snow had melted) a neighbor's child found it and returned it to me.  Not only did the camera still function perfectly, but the battery was still good, and all the pictures were still intact on the internal card.  AMAZING!  If I wanted anything more than a phone camera these days, I'd trust this brand/line.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and video for such a compact camera
Reviews.Author: Nico
Reviews.Content: All around, the best camera in it's class of sub compact point and shoots. I was so impressed with how easy it is to use that I bought another one for my parents.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, flimsy battery/sd card cover
Reviews.Author: R. Garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for its portability (and it was on sale too at $169). I also own a DSLR but for everyday photos I'd rather carry one that fits in my pocket. Excellent picture quality. I set mine to Program mode, My Colors to Vivid, and Auto-ISO (default). Crappy shots at high ISOs but you don't expect much from a compact. That's what DSLRs are for. Fast focusing and accurate most of the time. I will give this camera 5 stars if not for a flimsy battery cover. It will break easily if you're not extra careful.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I thought it would be
Reviews.Author: M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my Olympus SW broke before a trip to Disney.  From the reviews I thought it would be great.  If you want HD Video, this is a great camera because the video truly is spectacular.  I was not as impressed with the pictures despite it's stellar review.  My daughter has a Olympus FE-360 $99 point and shoot and we compare many similar images.  That $99 Olympus was always in focus and colors were sharp.  I cannot say the same with this $250 Canon.  I was really surprised.  As I used the camera, the face recognition frequently focused on the wrong spot and focus and colors both seemed off.  If you want to pay $50 more than one of the Flips, this may be a good camera, though because the video was superb.  I like the idea of HD Video but, would not recommend the pictures from this camera at the price.

Reviews.Title: Good; not great; flawed; expensive
Reviews.Author: db "db"
Reviews.Content: My son dropped my Canon SD1100is, a great camera that I loved, so I bought SD780is as a replacement, and was ultimately disappointed and returned the camera.  Both cameras are a very convenient size and they use the same battery. Problems I encountered with the SD780is are (1) that the door/piece/cover that covers where the battery and SD card are inserted was loose.  It shifted/wiggled/moved every time I took a picture, just a little bit but enough to be annoying and unacceptable in an almost-$300 point-and-shoot camera. It just felt cheap and wrong given the price that I paid and given that other cameras don't do this. At first I planned to exchange the camera, but then I found that the cover wiggled on the 2nd SD780is that I looked at too, so I got a refund. (2) Second, the HD video was a primary reason that I bought the SD780is instead of SD1200is, but when I viewed the HD video on my computers it consistently had a line/defect/artifact? through the video-not good. (3) Third, at one point the 780 camera screen didn't seem to turn on and function when I hit the power button, though later at the store it did turn on for the salesperson, so I'm not sure how to explain this unusual event. (4) Fourth, still picture lighting and flashing was inconsistent, producing some disappointing photos in normal-usage situations. (5) Lastly, shutter lag is a problem; there's often what feels like a half-second delay between the time that you push the button and when the picture is taken; this is a problem with a lot of point and shoots but is quite annoying even if lots of cameras have a similar flaw.  Overall, this might be an okay camera but I would also consider alternatives, especially considering the price.  I expected the newer, more expensive, SD780is to perform better than my older, cheaper SD1100is, but it did not deliver as I hoped and expected it would.

Reviews.Title: Nightmare
Reviews.Author: Camera Queen
Reviews.Content: Let me start bt saying I have always purchased and loved Canon products.  Until today.I wish I could say this canon camera has been a good expereince, but it has not! I went in search of a new small point and shoot to take to outings where I would not want to take my Canon rebel DSLR and my Sony handycam, and after researching cameras, felt like the Powershot 780IS was the best of both worlds; decent picture quality and decent video quality.  Initially I was pleased. After I received the camera I began taking snapshots and videos to see how it functioned.  Grainy in low light, nice pictures in overcast .. . then the sun came out. .  .oh boy.  I began getting lines down the LCD in both picture mode and video mode that showed up in playback and on download.  I was going to return the camera and after talking to Canon Tech they told me that it would be quicker and easier to go through Canon and get it fixed.  When I complained that I would be getting a "refurbished" camera than for the price of a new one, they told me I could discuss that with them and "work it out" once it got there. With the countdown to my vacation I had purchased it to take on at 2.5 weeks, I sent it back to Canon.  I received it back today, literally 1 day before we leave.. . and to my distaste, it continues to do the same thing.  Again on hold with Canon, they continue to tell me they will "repair" only, and that I should send it back to them, even though they have replaced the ENTIRE INSIDE OF THE CAMERA!  I attempted to take pictures AND video in my dining room where there are no windows ,just my chandelier, and now there are purple lines all down the LCD and on playback.  With my vacation 1 day away, I now need to decide send it BACK to canon, whose Customer Service has left little to be desired, or send it BACK to Amazon, for either a return or exchange.  With one day left until my vacation, clearly I will be cameraless. Perhaps this was an unfortunate incident, however if it was damaged and the inside replaced, it should be functioning properly.  So either it wasn't really fixed, or its a poorly made model.  You decide, I still haven't.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Picture Quaity
Reviews.Author: rfb100
Reviews.Content: I'm in a real minority here, and even though the camera is great in most all respects, the thing the camera is for - taking pictures - the camera I received produced terrible quality pictures.  They were blurry appeared out of focus and were not usable. Nothing I could do seemed to be able to fix it, so now the camera is back at Amazon and I will get a refund shortly, I hope. This would have been my third Canon SD Power Shot camera and the others have been great, but are old and becoming limited. This could be a quality control problem, or poor handling between wherever and here, and concerns only the unit I got. So my question is - should I try the same model again or move on elsewhere.  Anyone have any advice?

Reviews.Title: Canon SD780 IS digital camera is perfect for just about any use
Reviews.Author: Marty Mankins "amateur video and filmmaker"
Reviews.Content: I had previously purchase the SD1000 camera back in March of 2007, which was an upgrade from the Powershot S45 model.  Going to an Elph body brought with it lots of bonuses, like being able to take my camera to concerts and other places where a bigger camera was not an option.After more than 2 years with the SD1000, it was time to upgrade both my camera and my wife's.  She got the SD1000 while I ended up with the SD 780 IS.I would have purchased this camera locally, but the color options were limited to bright red and solid black, neither of which was appealing to me or where I would use the camera.As with the SD1000, I used my camera on a self made camera mount on my scooter - a 2006 Honda Metropolitan.  I film various videos throughout the spring and summer and having a small digital makes for some excellent footage.This camera also has an HD mode for video, which I've only used a few times in test videos.  In the near future, I will be using this mode more often.Image stabilization is nice, but I've not noticed any major improvements over using a camera that doesn't have it.  Perhaps more testing with this feature is needed, but overall, I've not missed the IS feature.Photo wise, it takes incredible pictures at just about any resolution.  I have mine in 1600x1200 mode, which is 2 megapixel and perfect for most of my photo needs (blogging, family photos, gatherings, outdoors activities).  One nice bonus feature is that it remembers your flash setting during a power off and power back on again.  Meaning, if you turned off the flash the last time you used it, the next time you power it back on, the flash will remain off.  This is a great feature when you are in a place where flash pictures are not allowed, making it so you don't forget to check the flash setting before taking the picture.For the price, this is a great camera for a wide variety of uses and it's proven itself to be a great model.The two gotchas are on this camera are:- the SD1000 used a .AVI extension on videos. This SD780 IS changes it to .MOV.  Using video footage from both cameras can prove to be difficult to manage individual files.- the case is all metal which is nice, but if you have wet or greasy fingers, it makes it slippery.  Adding a clear cover like InvisiSheild helps add some grip to the camera.

Reviews.Title: A Rare Combination of Functionality and Beauty
Reviews.Author: H. Wang
Reviews.Content: Purchased SD780IS from Amazon and has been using it for several months. It is purchased as an upgrade from my existing SD700IS Canon PowerShot SD700 IS 6MP Digital Elph Camera with 4x Image Stabilized Zoom, which is a excellent camera itself.Note: despite the lower numbers, both SD700IS and SD780IS are actually the higher end ones of Canon ELPH camera family. Canon REALLY needs to work out a better product numbering scheme. It takes me a while to figure out the differences between various models.Image Quality:- Excellent picture quality using auto mode in well lit settings. Fair picture quality in high ISO low light situation, which is expected for a compact point and shoot camera.- The smart auto mode automatically detect the setting, for example, back light situation. It works so well that I no longer use the manual mode even though I'm fairly comfortable with setting various modes due to my experience with digital SLRs.- The 720p HD movie mode delivers very good quality HD video, up to 70 minutes on a 16GB card.- With a under water enclosure Canon WP-DC31 Waterproof Case for SD780IS Digital Elph Camera, it takes great under water pictures and videos.Built Quality:- Despite its small size, the SD780IS feels solid in hand. All buttons and controls have the right amount of tactile feedback force.- The only minor issue is the battery/memory door feels a bit flimsy and need a bit of attention when closing to avoid mis-latch.Features:- Super slim and stylish body/color.- Very fast turn on time. A useful little feature: press Play button directly turns the camera on with lens retracted, great for showing pictures/movies to family and friends.- Smart auto mode works great.- Face detection is amazingly accurate, and is very useful for taking people shots.- Lack of panoramic mode is a major draw back, comparing to SD700IS.Comparing to other models:- Smaller than SD960IS Canon PowerShot SD960IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.8-inch LCD (Silver), almost the same feature except 3X zoom vs 4x zoom. I recommend choosing this over SD960IS.- From the specification, the newer SD940IS Canon PowerShot SD940IS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD (Black) is almost identical with SD780IS, but with wider angle lens and 4x optical zoom. If you don't mind the extra $50, I think it is a better buy.Summary:Pros: Image quality, HD video, slim sizeCons: Lack panoramic mode, less wide angle and optical zoom than SD940IS.Overall, SD780IS is a rare combination of high quality engineering and stylish design.

Reviews.Title: Slow camera 0.8fps:(
Reviews.Author: Patrick Nguyen "Trance Music"
Reviews.Content: I had Canon SD790IS and Canon SD1200IS before, this camera looks much nicer and sexier, but the preform of this camera is not as good as Canon SD 1200 IS. It is a slower camera. It can take 0.8fps while Canon SD 1200 IS can take 1.4fps, the only thing I can think of this camera is better than SD1200IS is the look is better and smaller.  You have to try both cameras to see the differences.  For me, Canon SD780IS is too little in my hand, and the buttons are too small, they are very hard to use.  Canon SD1200IS is easier to control.Canon SD 1200 IS is cheaper than this one about $50USD.

Reviews.Title: Fine if you want a small camera
Reviews.Author: sa
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife in April '09 so that it would be easier to keep in her purse when needed. It is indeed small and easy to carry around. This is our third Canon Powershot camera. I must say that the first one we owned took better indoor, zoomed pictures. This camera is awful when zoomed to the optical limit of 3x. (indoors) Outside the shots are fine. The HD video is impressive for a small camera. I just can't get over the BLURRRRRR every time a shot is taken indoors. Hmmmmm, I thought his had that new feature called Motion Detection Technology. If only I could get back my Canon 2MP camera. Oh well!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: S. Colakoglu ""Amiga500 Fan""
Reviews.Content: I am also very disappointed with the "picture quality".. They look very good on the LCD screen but when you upload it to the computer, the results are unacceptable.. Unfortunately I figured it out too late because of those high number of 5 star reviews and didn't send it back.(I thought that my expectations were too high).. The Kodak camera that I bought 5 years ago (3.1 MP) was doing 10 times better job..

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: Turtlerunner
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, small, easy for carrying around and takes great pictures.Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Deep Red)

Reviews.Title: Should've just rebought my old camera
Reviews.Author: popcornkid
Reviews.Content: Had a Canon Powershot 1200IS. It broke. Got this one, thinking it'd be the same, just higher res. pictures. I was wrong. Seems like it's lacking image stabilizing which was in the 1200. Shots only come out clear if it's on auto. in the program mode, hands must be stiller than a surgeons and still might come out blurry. Very frustrating. Stick with the 1200. I regret this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Marisa D
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a few weeks and have taken it on vacation twice.  I love it!  The pictures come out beautiful and you can do all of your editing right on the camera.  I think it is a great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Upset!!
Reviews.Author: KMJ
Reviews.Content: I received this camera in May as a graduation gift and was thrilled with it's size and the quality of the pictures. Well, it's now July and my camera's zoom no longer works and the error message comes up "Lens Error, Restart Camera". Customer service was of no use, it's now my responsiblity not only to ship the camera to them for repair but I have to pay all the costs!! I thought canon was such a great brand but if this is all the better their products hold up I think I would like a different brand.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE CAMARA
Reviews.Author: CECILIA FONG
Reviews.Content: ESTA ES LA MEJOR CAMARA QUE HE COMPRADO, TIENE CALIDAD DE FOTO EXCELENTE, DURABLE, SE ME HA CAIDO AL PISO MAS DE 10 VECES AL SUELO Y TODAVIA FUNCIONA PERFECTAMENTE, AUNQUE UN POCO RAYADA Y GOLPEADA FISICAMENTE, ES UNA CAMARA MUY FACIL DE LLEVAR POR SU TAMANO. ANTERIORMENTE HE TENIDO SONY Y OLYMPUS Y NADA COMO ESTA CAMARA EN CUANTO A CALIDAD DE FOTO.

Reviews.Title: Returned it, wish I could get my older model instead
Reviews.Author: D. Inwood
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Powershot SD600 (6 megapixel) and loved it but it broke so I bought this.  I returned this because it was not as good as my OLDER model!  What do I mean, not as good - I couldn't simply point and shoot with this.  When I pointed, pressed halfway to focus, then pressed all the way - the shot was delayed and inevitably horrible (motion of subject related). No matter how well charged the battery, the picture would not take quick enough.  No matter what setting I used, the pictures all showed movement instead of clearly snapping a moment in time.  I'm not sure why this is the case.We returned this camera and got an SD1400, which is more in line with my SD600, but we are having the same exact problem so I think these newer models are somehow different from the older ones.  If someone can explain how I can get the ease of use, simple, clear, great photos I am accustomed to - please let me know!

Reviews.Title: A good portable camera with hd video
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It's very small portable camera (even compared to other canon elphs) with HD video. Easy to carry and operate (even with only one hand if you want). Need a camera case. I bought a caselogic (Caselogic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage (Black)) for $8 at Amazon.com over a leather canon bag, and love with my decision. Picture quality is good but not anything exceptional like ones in DSRL cameras. HD video (780p) is an extra. For connecting to your HD tv, you need to buy a mini-HDML cable or just use an included usb cable. (I guess not much difference since hd720p)

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: J. A. Brown "J.A. Brown"
Reviews.Content: When it takes a focused picture, it's fantastic, save for what looks like water spots on the lens on a camera that hasn't been near the rain when taking pictures with dark tones in it. Even using a lens cloth to try to clean it hasn't helped. And 10% of the time it doesn't focus, meaning it's unreliable for getting impromptu shots.  It's also very slow to take a second picture.  This is my second Canon PowerShot and it will be my last.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SC780IS
Reviews.Content: Love this camera....it's so small, yet takes amazing pictures.  Take it everywhere I go and have gotten some memorable shots.

Reviews.Title: Poor low light/Indoor, small size, but not for primary use
Reviews.Author: Muruks
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon for my brother. I made this choice against several Panasonic and Sony point & shoot cameras after seeing the large number of positive user reviews this model received in Amazon. I currently own a Nikon DSLR(D40) with couple of additional lens. And hence I would be comparing this model with my DSLR for picture quality.I got the silver colour as the black did not seem impressive in the Amazon online product gallery (but i later saw a review from one of the user that black is indeed beautiful). After I opened the box and got the camera to the hand, the feeling was really great!, it felt very tiny and light weight, but I quickly became curious to know how is thing camera going to perform in picture quality - the main purpose we buy a camera for. I put in a 2 GB card quickly and started taking few pictures inside the room. The pictures came out grainy, even with flash - which was disappointing. The quality of pictures were not near the entry level DSLR or even bigger cousins (Powershot, 200$ and above models) from Canon. The reason could be smaller size of lens and sensor in this camera. The lack of manual mode or wide angle would not bother me as long as a camera can take really good photos at normal zoom (group of people, face, building etc)  which is where we use P&S; cameras 90% of the time. For me good picture quality in all modes (outdoor/indoor/night) stands as the primary reason for choosing a camera. While this camera can be great as a light weight travel camera for casual photography - I would suggest to go with a slightly higher end (with bigger aperture lens) model from Canon or Panasonic (Canon SX120IS around 200$ or Canon S90), you dont need fancier ones) . Or else you would be disappointed when you see the results from other bigger ones.

Reviews.Title: great little camera but remember to also order a memory card
Reviews.Author: L. Rockhead "reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for our 14 year old daughter before she left on a trip.  She loved the colour and found the camera easy to operate and fun to use.  However, we had to dash out shortly before catching her flight to buy the memory card which is essential to using the camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: P. Lundberg
Reviews.Content: I read all the glowing reviews here before purchasing this camera.  I used it for a month and ended up returning it.  There are many reviews here that go pretty in depth so I'll keep it simple.Obviously the form factor is excellent.  This camera is very compact.  Manual settings are pretty good for a camera in this class and the HDMI output is nice.But I bought this first and foremost as a point-and-shoot to replace an old 3.2 MP Sony.  This Canon could not match the 6 year old Sony in sharpness, color, or low light.  Very disappointing.  All the pictures were soft and grainy, the auto flash never seemed to come on when it needed to (and you can't force it on in auto mode), the focus was inconsistent, and the color often had an orange hue and was oversaturated.  I really don't understand how anybody could give this camera good ratings for picture quality.  Perhaps the same people who watch their TVs in "Vivid" mode or are making comparisons to a camera phone.  It can take OK pictures if you fiddle around with manual settings each and every time, but this defeats the purpose of a point-and-shoot. Most of my pictures are indoors. Outdoors this camera does perform better.  But so do most cameras.Video is OK for a camera I guess, but no match for my standard-def camcorder.It's pretty clear to me that a 12.1 MP sensor in a camera with this small of a lens does nothing except create unnecessarily large files.  As I already mentioned, the picture quality was actually less than my old 3.2 camera.  I know that may sound like I am exaggerating, but I compared them side by side and it was easy to see even to my untrained eyes.I replaced this camera with another Sony, a DSC-W290.  The Sony simply takes much better pictures with less hassle.  Only downsides are the physical size and the proprietary Memory Stick.  Granted, the physical size is a pretty big downside, but still a worthwhile tradeoff for me.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Abby
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a replacement for a previous model.  It is thinner than the one I replaced.  The size is great - fits easily into the pockets of my cargo shorts.  Uses the same battery as previous model and charger.  Now I have a backup battery and charger I can use for traveling.  Great point and shoot camera.  Great for snap shots at any gathering.  Lots of modes - love the black and white and sephia modes.  Fun to try out all of the features. Have enlarged pictures to 8x10 and am very happy with the quality.  I got the red for fun.

Reviews.Title: captures toddler
Reviews.Author: Aubi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter who has toddler. She has said that this camera has stopped the little one in her tracks. Even when there is movement the camera takes pictures without blur, and it tracks the face to always stay in focus. I was a diehard Nikon user, but the reviews I read lead me to this camera. I sure glad I listened and now I want this camera for my own. The video is great too.

Reviews.Title: Everything and more
Reviews.Author: K. Reinert "krsr"
Reviews.Content: I had researched several cameras before making this purchase. I typically take pictures with a Nikon D50, but I wanted a point-and-shoot that I could carry around more easily but still take decent pictures. This camera has not disappointed me. It's tiny but incredibly sturdy, and takes excellent quality pictures. In addition, I had video recorded a Christmas concert, and when I played it on my computer I expanded the video to "full-screen" and the image did not become grainy at all. I love this camera. It's an absolute steal for this price.

Reviews.Title: A very small but very powerfull Point-And-Shoot Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Matt "T"
Reviews.Content: You would not need all it's 12 Megapixels but it's good to have them for zooming into details and cropping of the picture after you took it.The picture quality is just perfect. Easy to use and very quick.The zoom could be bigger but it's more than enough for your everyday shooting situations and even a little more.I just like it and that's why we bought a second one for my wife. And she loves hers too. Especially how small it is.It really fits into every pocket and you can have it always handy.HD Video, can you believe it. Perfect quality. The audio is decent.It's hard to spoil a picture with this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Good things come in small packages
Reviews.Author: Jerome L. Steinberg
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera. I moved up from a 5 MP Sony Cyber-shot. It was small and the pictures were good, but this is truly amazing for its size. The battery life is excellent and the media is coming down in price. It will read up to 2 TB SD cards, when they eventually get around to making them. I bought a HDMI cable to camera connector for my HDTV and the movie I made looked like it was made professionally.The "anti-shake" system worked beautifully. I couldn't be happier with this camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: M. Gray "MK"
Reviews.Content: Exactally what I wanted. I had an old Elph (2 or 3 megapixels), and wanted to upgrade, so I bought the Nikkon. Never used it because the thing took crappy pictures, and was difficult to figure out. FInally wised up and went back to the Elph! So easy to use, and the picture quality is awesome!

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon L. Nelson "kramnels"
Reviews.Content: when I first got this camera it was so small I thought, this can't take very good pictures, but boy was I wrong, it takes great video and pictures,  size is so portable you can just stick it in your pocket! My daughter loves it!

Reviews.Title: Semi Pro
Reviews.Author: A. Can
Reviews.Content: Having the photography as my greatest hobby, and having taking pictures only using high end SLRs and Pro Lenses, I can tell this little monster is taking greater pictures than its size. I owned point and shoot cameras before, but none was as good as this one.

Reviews.Title: A great camera in a tiny size
Reviews.Author: C. Winslow
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Thailand where I used my new Canon PowerShot SD780IS.  It was very easy to use and the battery lasted a long time.  My pictures are sharp and videos clear.  The size is very convenient.  I bought a neck strap and wear it around my neck for convenience.  Amazon's price couldn't be beat!

Reviews.Title: excelent but  seems to be fragile
Reviews.Author: Marcio Luiz Goulart
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon PS 710IS and decided to change to a SD 780IS due to the tiny size and portabilityPros:Tiny size ans easy to carryGood quality moviesFast shutter - allows to take more than 2 pictures in 2 secondsExcelent battery life - taking more than 200 pictures with one full chargeContras:Seems to be fragile - don't drop itpoor optical zoom - should be at least 4 xdo not use rechargeable common batteriesDiffcicult to use special effects and faeturesFor my amateur and sporadical  use due to the excelent portability this camera fits.

Reviews.Title: Small wonder!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Steve
Reviews.Content: Had a Canon SD1000 that fell out of a car and was run over on a dirt road.  This camera is the same size, though more rounded, with many upgraded features and uses the same battery and memory so we can use them in the new camera as spares.  It takes great pictures and because it is so small you can take it anywhere.  Negatives?  Sometimes the shutter doesn't fire as fast as I would like.  Especially in low light with the flash on.  Also, be prepared to use your fingernails to push some of the menu buttons as they are small.  I opted for the gold color and glad I did as it sets my camera apart and makes it easy to identify among other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great compact digital camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Matthews
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month and I'm very impressed.  Previous camera was a Sony DSC that was about 4-5 years old.  Digital cameras have come a long way since then.Did quite a bit of online research on this camera, mainly looking at Amazon reviews.  Considered buying the 1200 model but the reviews about the video quality of the 780 tipped the scales.The size of this camera is remarkably small.  The size of the display is remarkably large.  I have been able to use it for still photos and video without needing to read the instruction manual.  Uploading the photos to my computer and sharing on Facebook were a breeze as well.I'm happy with the purchase, I think it was a good value and can't wait to try it out on an upcoming trip to Europe.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SD780IS12.1 Review
Reviews.Author: D. Scott
Reviews.Content: This camera is far superior to my last digital camera albeit my last one was 5 years old.  It would seem that digital cameras had improved a lot in five years.  The Canon takes great photos with little talent needed by the operator. The only area that I give it less than a perfect score is "ease of use" - the camera was much smaller than I expected and as I have large hands its very compactness makes it a little award for me to operate.

Reviews.Title: Love the speed!
Reviews.Author: Zbison "Zbison"
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought entirely b/c my old camera would take too long after you pressed the button until it actually took the picture - this one is nearly instant on the children/pets setting.  I spent a little extra to get the HD video feature b/c I think all things will be HD soon and I'll be glad I made the investment.  This is our only camera we use know to take pics and video of my infant son.  It is awesome.  The buttons are a bit small, but nothing that would deter me from buying the camera again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Compact and convenient
Reviews.Author: Katie Colon
Reviews.Content: As a long time Canon user this camera is perfect for quick, on-the-go shots at parties, events, and to keep in your bag.  Easy to use and little effort for really great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Annie Beth "Callie"
Reviews.Content: A great little camera, perfect for James Bond types, it's that small. Very easy to use, and even looks good to. We got the gold one. Takes very good pictures. Cannot find 1 problem, yet.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Doron D. Kahana
Reviews.Content: Fantastic quality, very compact, quick and easy to use.  I've had several Canon SD series cameras and this one takes the cake.  Its size is perfect for on-the-go, the picture quality is amazing, the settings are easy to use, and the pictures come out sharp and well-focused.  I'm really very pleased!  I'm convinced you can't beat it for $200.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera
Reviews.Author: Col Edwin A. Porter
Reviews.Content: I don't like the color, black, makes features on the camera hard to read.Camera works great. Transferring pictures from the camera to the computer is easy. Has a viewfinder which is wonderful. Zooms in & out very well. A fine camera. Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: IMPRESSIVE
Reviews.Author: J. Irwin
Reviews.Content: Very happy with camera, have taken about 200 photos during my first month.The picture quality is good, with tons of settings.The HD video is a huge plus, the quality is amazing.I like the size, it packs easily into my pocket, so i can take it everywhere.At the price paid, this camera is a real value, I highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: best camera i've owned!
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply fantastic.  It has everything you could really want all packed into this tiny little elph!  Takes great photos, the automatic scene feature is outstanding and works flawlessly.  Macro shots look professional and the HD video is superior for a digital camera.  My only complaint is no optical zoom during movie mode (only digital, which distorts the picture).  Shoots well in low lit areas when using flash, otherwise pictures are a bit grainy.  The camera is very attractive in design and small enough to take on the go.  Battery life is average, but it only take 90 minutes for a full recharge!  I'm glad I purchased this instead of the Sony w290.

Reviews.Title: This thing has some horsepower
Reviews.Author: Beach Life
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little camera. The thing is tiny in size (thinnest yet) but huge on performance. The still image quality is really, really nice and dude,...HD video at 720p out of this thing? Sweet.We shot a recent trip to Europe with this camera and left our DSLR at home. I was worried about carrying around just a point-and-shoot but I gotta say that the pictures came out so beautiful.You really can't go wrong with this. I highly recommend. For me, it's Canon for point-and-shoots and Nikon for DSLRs.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Davie
Reviews.Content: I wanted something nice and small to carry around with me.  This camera is perfect for me.  It fits very nicely in my shirt pocket and it takes a nice pic and video to boot.  This camera is best for well lit scenes.  Most digital cameras have the same issues with low light so I'm fine with that.  For dark scenes, get a mini tripod and learn to use the long shutter.  You can do great things with this camera if you learn how to use it.  Read the manual...you'll be glad you did.  If you want award winning photos, get a digital slr if you just wanna take nice pictures of family, friends, and your dog, this camera is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Father's Day Gift
Reviews.Author: Barbara K. Nourse
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Father's Day gift for my husband.  He absolutely loves it.  It arrived in plenty of time and was priced comparably with like cameras advertised in the newspaper.  The size makes is great for carrying to soccer games or orchestra concerts.  Great present.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Teresa Cannady
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on the recommendation of a friend who had an older version and have been extremely pleased.  It is compact and lightweight and more importantly, makes great pictures.  The image stablization feature is excellent.  It is simple to use and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Nz
Reviews.Content: I was looking to get a compact digital camera that takes great photos and I couldn't ask for a better quality camera than this. It's sleek and looks very good. The pictures come out very nicely.  There is no problem with taking pictures at night.  I love the features it has.. very easy to use.  My one complaint is that the gold looks more like copper.. but it is still very nice.  If you're a female I'd definitely get the gold.  I LOVE this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great lil camera.
Reviews.Author: IncredibleHat
Reviews.Content: This replaced a brick of a Sony piece of crap. This cannon is so incredible over that Sony one I had.The images are not studio quality, but I expected that. They are however adequate for all casual use and snapshots. A little photoshop cleanup and reduction makes them very crisp and clean. I always set the camera to take photos as large a file as possible, to give me the most pixels for reduction.Its a little effy at night, and depending on your tastes, the slow-syncro setting is either really cool, or a real mess haha. Works excellent with a tripod though.The thing I enjoy the most vs prior cameras? I can slip it in any pocket, take it anywhere, and its just there.

Reviews.Title: It's a nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Walter Deinzer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera for point and shoot pictures. I'm sure there are other features, but I just needed a basic camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: UNION PLUS
Reviews.Content: WISH I HAD ALL THESE FEATURES ON MY OLD 35mm SLR CAMERAS, THIS CAMERA IS GREAT TO TAKE ANYWHERE WITHOUT BEING WEIGHTED DOWN, IT RECHARGES VERY EASY TAKES GREAT PICS WOULD RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.NOW IF I COULD JUST REMEMBER WHERE I PUT IT.....

Reviews.Title: Nice small camera
Reviews.Author: lowee
Reviews.Content: Love canons, I have several of them. This is the smallest and takes good pics, very easy to use. Love the color as we'll!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality in low light
Reviews.Author: Linder
Reviews.Content: Takes decent shots in bright sunny light, but anything darker than that, even using various different settings, pictures are dark and poor quality. At first it seemed like a good buy but the more photos I take the less happy I am with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Norma J. Whalen ""book  buzz""
Reviews.Content: I carry it with me everywhere!  I get great pictures with it and I use it whenever carrying my Canon EOS 60D isn't practical...which, unfortunately, is most of the time.  This camera is amazing for its size.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image...
Reviews.Author: TOM SERTICK
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image...I use this camera at work for 2 years and took 5000 picsand videos. I bought 3 more for my friend ... they love them...4 years I am still using it.

Reviews.Title: WICKED RED
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Arrived,as a birthday surprise and I just love it. I also recommend the Canon,Red Case.Super and convenient to place in my hand / tote bag upon my travels.Over the years,Canon has and still remains to be my personal, # 1 choice.

Reviews.Title: This is the perfect small camera with an actual viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Stu Redman
Reviews.Content: This Canon camera was one of the very last made compact cameras with an actual viewfinder.  You need a real viewfinder if you ever use your camera in bright sunlight as you won't be able to see the display well enough to shoot buy it.  The batteries last very long time and are inexpensive.  These are well known for their reliability and should last for a very long time.I use Amazon for most of my purchases and update my reviews if anything changes with the products. I do this so other Amazon users can get a real feel for the life of the product. You can look at my review which will be close to my purchase date and tell how the product is doing as time passes.  I am not associated with any company and all opinions are my very own.

Reviews.Title: canon poet shot SD 780IS 12.1 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Varese
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome pictures. Its size is great to carry in a jacket pocket or a bike bag. Pretty color which helps see it  if it's in the bottom of ones purse or among other contents.

Reviews.Title: Nice, small camera
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth A. Bingham "horse'n around"
Reviews.Content: Although I wouldn't buy this camera NOW, when I got it, I felt it was a very good choice.  The reason I got it makes choices limited and that is that it has an optical viewfinder.  I have not treated the camera kindly and it has stood up to the abuse well.  I mainly use the pix for posting on Facebook and the quality is fine, as are the features.

Reviews.Title: Purchase two of the same cameras
Reviews.Author: Shop0h0lic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my sister and myself in 2010. I own a DSLR and I'd save I've purchased five cameras just for myself (Sony, Canon, Nikon, you name it!) in the past 8 years.  I used my Canon Powershot SD780IS camera very frequently and did not take care of it as much as I should have in college. My camera broke in less than a year when I dropped in on a concrete floor. On the other hand, my sister takes a very good care of the camera, but her zoom in and out button got stuck after 2 years of infrequent use. She never dropped the camera so the button must have just given up. Although I don't think this camera is the most durable camera in the market, at the end of the day, the camera still works and I absolutely love the pictures that it takes! I'd even purchase a third one if my sister's gives out.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Becky LeClair
Reviews.Content: Awesome little camera for a mom or dad to carry with them ALL the time!  Small, durable, and takes great quality pictures!

Reviews.Title: Fun camera good quality
Reviews.Author: Sterling
Reviews.Content: takes really good pictures, although a bit slower than my iPhone. macro function takes good close ups. i definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Just purchased this and love it
Reviews.Author: CJ Simmons "CJ Simmons"
Reviews.Content: Small but hefty. Easy functionality, I will need to add more to this review once I am able to fully test. Software that came with it was not needed on my new Macbook Pro (I checked for firmware updates on Canon's site)

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: W. Lang
Reviews.Content: This little camera is a work horse. My wife uses this camera for everything and its been working well for a long time. We plan on upgrading to a larger phone in the future, but for the quick and dirty photos this works great.

Reviews.Title: Always on video mode, love it!
Reviews.Author: Cervantes
Reviews.Content: I got this camera at a electronics store a while back...in 2009. I paid $300 which was very expensive for me but worth it. I can't believe its $400+ now haha. The look of the camera is great, it feels very solid in hand. I mostly use it for video to record music performances. This camera does a fantastic job. People always ask me what camera I use because the sound/video is good. Pictures look good but, that's all I can say. I'm not a picture person. It's always on HD video mode!

Reviews.Title: One of the most important things about getting "The Shot" is having your camera
Reviews.Author: M. Vonk
Reviews.Content: I love this camera because it is so tiny and takes pretty darn good pictures.One of the most important things about getting "The Shot" is having your camera handy, and with the small size of this one, you can easily slide it into a front pocket and have it with you at all times.  I travel with mine and always like having my camera close.It's great for landscapes, people shots, and is especially awesome for super-close up shots.  I found a cluster of orchids no bigger than my pinkie finger that was not that pretty, but when I took a picture super-close so that you could see the individual flowers it was a thing of beauty.The only thing it can't do very well are zoom in on distant objects.  ...So just let your friends lug around the huge telephoto lenses for those shots and you can get all the (more interesting) people, situation, and macro shots.

Reviews.Title: Disappoinment
Reviews.Author: Jongho Ostreicher
Reviews.Content: I've always swore by canon products but the quality of the pictures for this camera wasn't as up to par.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera of its time
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: Good compact camera for the price. Still in usage since purchase years ago!Steel exterior ensures durability for many more years to came

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Scott Hylton
Reviews.Content: It's easy to navigate through the different functions, and you can be ready for the perfect picture in a snap.

Reviews.Title: Not the same as the Original
Reviews.Author: C. Escoe
Reviews.Content: Farrrr from the Canon SD7801S purchsed from Best Buy. Some features are not in this and the picture quality is poor.  Seems to be a knock off version though it says Canon.  I purchased the same model from Best Buy and my husband envied it so I bought him this for his Birthday, disappointing! Buy the real deal from an electronic store you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Deep Red)
Reviews.Author: Love my dog
Reviews.Content: Used - arrived in very good condition. Lost previous one and wanted to replace. The stabilizing features is great for unsteady hands. Takes very good pictures and it is light.

Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: Brittany D. Steffey
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect.  It takes great pictures during the day, and is wonderful for travelers, since it's about the size of a deck of cards.  Mine is at least four years old, and has been carried, dropped, and used on three continents and in sixteen countries with no problems.  Admittedly, it's not the best for taking pictures at night unless you're willing to mess with the settings a lot, but few point-and-shoot digital cameras are.  If you're on a budget, but want a great camera that's easy to travel with (and isn't showy enough to get you mugged in questionable foreign neighborhoods) choose this one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Johnson
Reviews.Content: Great point and shot camera.  I have hauled it all over the world and it takes a beating.  I have been very impressed with the video option which records in HD.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! You'll never want to change it
Reviews.Author: dd "dd"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a while back and goodness how I love it! Take it with me everywhere I go because fits even in my pocket! The clarity of the pictures are outstanding and the effects can make are amazing! So glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera For The Money
Reviews.Author: ERICA MOODY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera. It's very small so it's easy to carry with you. Takes good pictures, not grainy at all.

Reviews.Title: most bang for my buck!
Reviews.Author: sic5hifter "sic5hifter"
Reviews.Content: owned this camera for 3 years. somehow only able to review it now. I purchased it from Beach Camera thru Amazon. They ship fast. Somehow last February 2013 while I was in Chicago to visit my cousins, I left my camera. So happen they are gonna visit my dad's in FL. so I just told them to drop it off there. But my dad like the camera and wanted to have it for him. So now I miss this little thing.This is very tough. Although not advertised as such, I used this as an action cam. Attached it to my helmet when snowboarding, also to my motorcycle handle bar. It held up pretty good. Good quality but not Contour/GoPro quality obviously. Also, it's got an optical viewfinder which is really a plus since that's really what I look for in a camera and it's rare to find camera's this size to have an optical viewfinder these days. Still images are great! 12.1mp gives you that... 12.1mp quality. And I don't think I need any more than that for my kind of usage. Im not a fan of big bulky DSLR's and this tiny thing fits in my skinny pants front pocket. I havent found a replacement for it yet and since I already have a ContourRoam action cam, I may not be looking for a point and shoot camera for a while. I mostly take picture using my phone now.

Reviews.Title: Smile!
Reviews.Author: Gorz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I had the same exact model but it was ruined while I was kayaking. Easy to travel with and takes high quality photos.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera... it's light and small and super easy and takes great pictures... I would recommend this camera to my friends...

Reviews.Title: One of the best used products I have ordered on Amazon!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Chin
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest and say I was a bit weary about ordering a used product that didn't have any pictures of the actual item, or a real description for that matter. But I saw that the seller was backed by Amazon Marketplace so I decided to go out on a limb. The saying "Don't be afraid to go out on a limb, that's where the best fruit are." really proved true this time. This "used" camera looks better than my camera (which was very lightly used before it was broken). I have used the camera several times and each time I am reminded of why I love my initial Canon SD780IS. Such a great great great deal. Really very pleased with this product.Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great camera, should have gotten one sooner
Reviews.Author: James C. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: Has all of the features that I was looking for. Small compact and versatile. The accent color features are magical

Reviews.Title: Maybe the best camera of its size on the market
Reviews.Author: James Donald McGinnis
Reviews.Content: My IT guy helped me select this camera just before a trip to Europe we were taking.  Over 5000 photos later, the battery is still very good, the camera (holstered in a custom case) looks as good as the day it was purchased and the photo quality in a variety or professional setting is commonly mistaken for photos taken by my son's frame 7.

Reviews.Title: Great little shooter
Reviews.Author: D. R. M. "wicmar"
Reviews.Content: I've been using mine for over 3 years for video and stills, and it's perfect for informal use. I love mine. I'm sure there are better pocket shooters now, but I see no need to change. The only minus is the slow response of the shutter release; which is normal with these little point and shoots. Not much good for anything that moves.

Reviews.Title: An excellent compact digital camera option for photographers at all levels of skill
Reviews.Author: Thomas H. Cochran
Reviews.Content: This camera is a very good, highly compact option for those photographers who can't carry around bulkier equipment. It has both a viewfinder and optical image stabilization, features now near impossible to find on very small digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Bought Used
Reviews.Author: Jillian Mays
Reviews.Content: I loved the one I lost. I will love thisreplacement as much. It is a versitlepiece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: SUPER SMALL CARRY IN MY POCKET
Reviews.Author: surestop
Reviews.Content: This is just the best camera ever this is my 3rd one seems everyone really like the Canon SD788 they keep taking it from me.

Reviews.Title: Great "little" camera!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Michael Zakula
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for carrying in your pocket to catch all those "special moments" and great photo ops.  This little camera takes great pictures and is easy to use.  Strongly recommend it - this is the second one of these that I've owned and many of my friends have been impressed with the great pictures I get with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: kayell
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera over 3 years now and it's still everything I could have hoped for. I consider myself an amateur and mainly use it for taking pictures/video of my son, family vacations, that sort of thing. I love the small size and ease of use (even my 4 year old can take decent pictures with it). I keep it in Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case (Black) when not using it and that has saved it from many drops. Battery life is still good after all this time. Like I said, I'm an amateur, but I think the pictures and video come out great especially considering the price of this camera.

Reviews.Title: 3 year old camera, works great!
Reviews.Author: kalajo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when my now, 3 year old son, was only 3 months old. It wasn't my first digital camera, but it was my first canon digital camera. I loved this camera! Shot with it every day. I eventually upgraded to a Canon t1i dslr, and now to a Canon 6D. I'm a professional photographer and I still keep this little camera in my purse for quick shots or video. It works just as great as the day I got it! Naturally I compare it to my DSLR, and obviously it's not as great, as far as image quality and image noise goes, but I love it for personal shots of my family while we're out and about, rather than carrying around my giant full frame dslr.Overall, great little purse/pocket camera. I was surprised when I looked it up on amazon (wanted to see the video specs) and I saw the price was still pretty high on this little guy! I bought it on sale, and after seeing the price here on amazon, it actually made me love it a little more, knowing it's still selling at full cost even after there have been multiple new models. :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for travelling
Reviews.Author: Miss T.C.
Reviews.Content: I previously purchased this model couple of years ago.  I accidentally dropped it in my carport and ran over it with my car.  I can't see a camera screen in sunlight, so I loved the view finder.  I brought it to a local camera store and it couldn't be repaired nor replaced.I checked the Amazon site and found a used one identical to the one I had.  It is in great condition and I am so happy I have it.Miss TC

Reviews.Title: It's smaller than I thought, but i still like it.
Reviews.Author: Yang Pao Cheng
Reviews.Content: This is one solid piece of work and i feel as if it was built to last. I bought mine used so it had a few scratches on it, and the shutter wouldn't open so i had to use my fingers to sort of pry them open. It takes rather good pictures, and it's decent in low light. I would reccomend this to anyone who is looking for a very portable, rough camera that takes pretty good pictures. Video isn't too bad and the battery life is pretty amazing. I love this tiny camera.

Reviews.Title: Just like the old one
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I lost my Canon camera and, within two weeks I had a perfect replacement.  I was able to immediately use the "new" device just as I had used the od model.  All my accessories work with my product.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Nonprofit Maven
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot has a viewfinder and is the reason I purchased it. It takes good photos and decent videos.

Reviews.Title: The digital camera I have had. I bought it almost 3 years ago.
Reviews.Author: Alberto Morillo Rdguez
Reviews.Content: Hello,I bought this camera on August 2010. This camera has fallen to the floor many times. It has received salt water and sand while my family is shooting photos on the beach every year.After all the camera is still working in the same way as the first day we received it from Amazon.It is very easy to use. If you don't want complications, and just want take photos, choose this camera.Regards,Alberto Morillo

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: C. Eusebio "-Crystar"
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice! I like it and it's pretty cool it's in red, which makes it a lot easier to find the camera. I will be definitely using it for vacations and whatnot.

Reviews.Title: small, great pics
Reviews.Author: susan t
Reviews.Content: Love this camera for it's great pictures and small foot print.  Fairly easy to use, too.  Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Nancy L. Miller
Reviews.Content: As a rookie digital camera user, I have really enjoyed using this camera.  It is easy to use and I like the fact that it has video also.  It takes great pictures.  My only complaint is that it is a little small for large hands (husband).

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: NovelSpirit
Reviews.Content: Came with all its stuff ieChargerComposite cableUSB CableBatteryWrist strapCamera and camera caseInstructionsUnscratched and clean screenThey sold it as described.Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph
Reviews.Author: Helen Grayce Ezarik
Reviews.Content: The Elph is a great camera, that is why I wanted a second one.Blue Sky Trader evidently did not know the camera had a problem, therefore I will give him a 5 Star Rating, the speed of the transaction was awesome.  I have an Elph but wanted a second one for my sister, and was happy to get it. He was very gracious in his email and set my mind at ease. Thanks hopefully I can find a used elph. Thanks to Amazon and Blue Sky Trader.

Reviews.Title: This is in my wifes purse all the time
Reviews.Author: turkeyman28
Reviews.Content: This is in my wifes purse all the time it has almost replaced our digital SLR except for special occations it has great pics and with a case very durable.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: Great shutter speed, and picture quality. There were plenty of times I thought I had missed the moment and my camera didn't catch the picture from a moving car, but the camera was great and got the picture - and did not have any fuzziness in the picture at all. Only thing I cannot figure out is how to get the right picture lighting at night, as these pictures tend to come out really dark. I like that this has a viewfinder, which you can't find anymore.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: L. Cirillo
Reviews.Content: What an amazing camera!  Small so it fits in your purse; easy to use so you'll use it often, and the quality of the photos is remarkable!  So happy I decided to buy it!

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: Shooting for fun
Reviews.Content: Before buying I read a lot of reviews and this camera is an awesome point and shoot. So compact and the pics & videos are very clear even the sound. I wish it had a greater zoom but it takes really good action and still photos.

Reviews.Title: Obsolete now
Reviews.Author: P. Blake
Reviews.Content: This camera did not live up to my expectations in the picture quality arena. There are better cameras out their, but Canon still makes the BEST powershot hand held cameras.

Reviews.Title: Love the color red, and the quality
Reviews.Author: B. Li
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my family as a gift. It was very light, and the red color was beautiful. Furthermore, the picture quality was as good as most the Canon cameras. Very happy about it.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch, Compact Camera with HD Video
Reviews.Author: David Berriman
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat this thing.  I wish I had bought another one when they were on sale.  I have had 2 of these (my first was lost or stolen) and they have exceeded expectations both times.  This camera takes wonderful photos as well as high quality HD video.  It has plenty of settings, if you like to mess around with such things, and comes with a battery that has long-lasting life when fully charged.  It's rugged too, and is as small and handy as one could ever ask for in a camera while still being solid and bulky enough to handle with normal-sized hands.I love this camera...the Canon PowerShot SD780IS...and would highly recommend it to anyone.  Price tends to fluctuate.

Reviews.Title: takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: Allen T. Chen
Reviews.Content: Used this camera for a few years and have taken great pictures through out the years on my several trips.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: John Jackl
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a while now. It's great! If you're not a professional photographer and need/want to take great pictures when you are out and about this camera is for you! It's simple and small. You can stick it in you shirt pocket and have it ready for that "Kodak Moment" in an instant. The automatic setting is great for no thinking photography. But it also has a manual mode for those that know what they are doing and feel the need to be creative. As a bonus there is a video mode so you can shoot video and upload to you tube. It is small. If there is a downside to the camera, it is the size. If you have large hands/fingers it may be a little difficult to navigate some of the controls. I got used to it. Just remember to take it with you!

Reviews.Title: non-techie
Reviews.Author: pams
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for even non-techies. Easy to figure out and to use, small enough to keep in your purse or pocket. It goes everywhere with me! This is actually a replacement for my original one that met with an unfortunate accident, but I knew I wanted the exact same camera again. I got refurbished this time to save some money, so I'm counting on it to last just as long as my original. Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Awesome delivery time
Reviews.Author: Inito_2012
Reviews.Content: I already owned one of these before which unfortunately got wet and stopped working. I ordered the same one again because I find this camera to be one of the best in the market for it's value. The camera is small enough that it's easy to carry in your pocket. The picture quality is great and the menu navigation is easy and straight forward. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera,, While it worked
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "diy fyi"
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera. My first really shirt pocket camera. Purchased in December 2009, so when it died, it was just short of two years old. Never dropped, never exposed to excessive heat or cold. One day I was taking photos outside, then nothing but purple haze in the LCD viewfinder. I am pretty sure it is the CCD or the associated electronics that went south as setup and all other functions work perfectly. Just purple haze now.  Seems like a digital camera should last longer than 22 months, especially at the price we paid. It was not cheap at the time; still isn't. Maybe it is a fluke as most reviews are generally very positive and generous. Could have been a real disappointment had the camera upchucked on a trip or any other photo immediate moment.Pros:Shirt pocket sizeSturdy aluminum case with rounded edges (comfortable to carry and pocket0Convenient lanyardgreat optics for price range with exceptional zoomLarge capacity SD HC supportVideo was very good considering optics and size limitation.  More than adequate for web presentation.Cons:Died at 22 months!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: C. John Smith
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. Its so small but takes AMAZING pictures. Comparing this camera to the 12mp Nikon Coolpix camera I stole from walmart. This one outshines it in every aspect (especially the HD video mode). I've taken this camera to different state parks, beaches, horseback riding, rapelling, traveled to costa rica and domican republic with this camera.  I'm not going to go into to much detail sinces theirs hundreds of other better reviews. I just wanted to show some love to Canon for making a great product.Pros: HD video, Crisp amazing pictures, Very compact, Great price (Got it for only $180 New!!)Cons: I wish it had a higher optical zoom, but with the compactness of camera and the lens size its not possible.Overall: Best compact Point and Shoot out there!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: ST
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  The picture and video quality are amazing for this size camera.  Bought this model since it had a viewfinder along with the LCD screen.  Previous cameras that I had owned (not Canon) were difficult to see the shot being taken in the screen in sunlight.  Not an issue on this camera.  I don't even use the viewfinder (even in bright sunlight) since the screen is so crisp and clear.  Very happy with this purchase and would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: 5 Star with proviso
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great take along camera. No bulging pockets or big case to worry about. Takes great pictures with video feature to boot. One problem I found (for me) is when zoomed out fully and then you later want to print a 8X10, the finer details will be pixelated but not noticeable with 4x6 prints. However, in fairness, this could be an IS issue at full zoom(?) or photographer (me) trying to do too much image correction. Will have to try more 8X10's with no zooming or image correction. Megapixel size should be enough for 8x10's so not sure what problem might be (and, yes, image quality is set to maximum in menu).

Reviews.Title: Good for what you pay for
Reviews.Author: ziggy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted a simple point-and-shoot camera. For the money you pay, the quality of the images is AMAZING. may be a bit too amazing for my purposes lol.

Reviews.Title: THIS CAMERA IS INDESTRUCTIBLE!
Reviews.Author: mellieb
Reviews.Content: Okay, I am seriously in LOVE with this camera.  It takes beautiful, high quality photographs.  But not only that, but it is seriously indestructible!  It has gotten run over by a car, and survived.  It has been dropped in a sand pit and had sand stuck in the lens, and survived.  Recently, it got dropped in a river in the mountains and although it ruined the lens, the camera still works!  Since the lens doesn't work anymore due to the water damage, I just had to order it's replacement.  However, I could not be more satisfied with how this camera takes the wear and tear of adventures!  If you want a camera for on the go, one that you won't have to be real careful  with, this is definitely the one for you!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Video Quality!!
Reviews.Author: R. Callahan
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect for my front pocket when I go out to the bars! It's small design is great, and I love when someone snatches the camera out of my hand to review a photo, they can easily see the playback button and I don't have to show them where it is (you KNOW that happens all the time!)I just keep it on auto mode, in portrait subjects tend to be washed out by the flash, somehow auto is the best.The viewfinder is pointless, got all dusty from being in my pocket and even when it was clean it is too small to look thru.MOST OF ALL THE HD VIDEO IS AMAZING! I am a paid YouTube guru and you would think that I use a professional camcorder but I don't! I use this gem and I get compliments ALL the time!I actually upgraded to the SD3500 and the video was NOT comparable, I am selling on craigslist now and going back to my beat up SD780 IS!Check out my YouTube channel for Proof! [...]

Reviews.Title: I love the Canon SD780 IS Digital Elph!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Logian
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with photos I've taken of people at weddings, of waterfalls while hiking, of birds in flight, and so much more, using the Canon SD780 IS Digital Elph. Others who view my photos make comments like "Wow. Great shot! Great camera! Nice quality!"A very sturdy and reliable camera in my opinion, with many options for formatting pictures, including wide shots.I've dropped this camera many times and it still takes great pictures. I'm about to buy my third, however, because since the last time I dropped it I can no longer switch to video mode. Notice I keep replacing it with the same camera, even though I can get a more powerful camera for less money these days.A BIG reason I like this camera is because it has an actual viewfinder! Not the best viewfinder ever, but helpful when you want to steady the camera by holding it close to you and locking it in place with your arms against you. Can't do that as easily with new cameras that have no viewfinder. Whoever came up with the idea to eliminate viewfinders, well, I don't want to say what I think of them here. A note to camera makers - BRING BACK VIEWFINDERS! Please.

Reviews.Title: Teriffic Customer Service! :)
Reviews.Author: angelinsnow
Reviews.Content: Originally, this camera arrived without a strap. However, the vendor very quickly (and at his own expense) purchased the missing strap and mailed it to me! Terrific vendor and a wonderful little camera! So easy to use and superb picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Optical Zoom is 3x, not good enough for me
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I had to buy a camera for photography class, and so looking at the reviews, I couldn't see anything majorly wrong with this camera.  As I started doing a couple of assignments, I felt severely restricted.  By what? By the Optical Zoom.  It is only 3x, and I'm sure other, cheaper cameras can do better than that.  Yes, I know it said that before I bought it, but I had never owned a camera before. (Btw don't use digital zoom, quality is bad)  I am estimating, but with the 3x optical zoom, maybe it can go 20 feet, maximum.  I just hate that it couldn't go further.  Other than that, I agree with the other reviewers.  It's small, portable, and compact.  Oh, and I love the HD video function.

Reviews.Title: What a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Lorna M. "hockey mom"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera over a year ago and just needed to write a review.  Bought this to replace my previous Canon power shot that was about 8 years old and a bit outdated (but still worked like a charm).  Decided on it after much research and rather than paying an electronics store price, I ordered from Amazon and saved about $40 at the time.The weight of this camera for it's size is impressive - feels and looks very well made; at the same time, I was a bit skeptical of such a small camera not only taking good photos but being durable.  After several vacations, holidays, etc. I am thrilled with this camera.  The picture quality is excellent, features are pretty user-friendly, and it easily fits into a pocket, even in the case!  Canon is the only camera brand I will buy and I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for an everyday camera with exceptional quality at an affordable price.(Recently bought my teenage daughter this one from Amazon, also at a great price: Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)  Will certainly do a review on that once it survives her crazy, busy summer.)

Reviews.Title: One great little camera
Reviews.Author: Janet Spain "Jan Spain"
Reviews.Content: Although I have at lest five cameras at home, this one is my go to camera when I need a little guy that is reliable and fast. It is really attractive...the red color is deep and vibrant. This camera lives up to Canon's reputation for taking  great pictures and the size is so convenient. I know there are newer models out there but this one is a keeper for me!

Reviews.Title: Finally a great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pearl
Reviews.Content: This camera wins the prize!!! The clarity of the pictures are really something I've never seen. It's a small size that makes it really practical to stick into any small carry-on bag wherever you're going. I'm really pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera great - dealer not so good!
Reviews.Author: tjexpress
Reviews.Content: The camera was exactly what I wanted.  No problems there. But dealer, before I even received camera wanted me to give them a good review. Waited and when I got my camera, the charger came with a plug for other countries, not USA.  Also the manual disk was in another language.  I notfied the dealer "Camera 4 U on Amazon Marketplace" and got a response that they would have a converter for the plug sent to me and for me to download the manual from Canon.  That was a week ago and have not seen anything yet! I emailed them a couple of days ago and no response.So if you decide to purchase the camera besure and choose a different dealer!

Reviews.Title: great digital camera
Reviews.Author: Beebee
Reviews.Content: My husband has SDR camera so I was looking for a small but intelligent camera then I bought this camera. It was perfect for me. Small, light, durable, easy to use, good quality picture and video. I recomment it.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Joshua Amato "Josh"
Reviews.Content: We have had this little camera for about two years and it really is great. It was a step up from the 8mp power shot that we had before it but just the same lay out and use which I really like, not a lot to learn. Photos are great for a 12mp camera, I can't say that it is anything special you get what you pay for and you get better photos the mp you have simple as that. If you have used a Cannon in the past you will be right at home all the same interface as almost any Cannon for the last ten years, from point and shoot to SLR.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Owned
Reviews.Author: K. B. Asante
Reviews.Content: Then again I made sure to check the reviews of this one before purchasing it back in 2008; and 3 years later its still in top shape, functioning as well as it did the first day I bought it. I like everything about it, it even records if need be. Take care of this camera as you would your other electronics and it will be there for you for as long as you'd like.

Reviews.Title: NOT THAT GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Wolfee1
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera because of it's size, and the wonderful Reviews, it is so small, it fits anywhere, my sister liked it so much I got one for her Birthday as well, hers is Deep Red, mine in Silver color, after we had the Cameras for a while and I am always taking pictures , we noticed that the shutter speed is too slow, I have to wait for the Camera to do it's thing before I take the next Picture and many times the object is gone, the automatic flash is not reliable enough, a lot of the pictures are too dark or out of focus, my sister doesn't want to use it anymore, and I feel the same way. We have this Camera for a year now, and looking for a better one preferably a Sony Cyber-Shot like I used to own, I thought it was the best, till I dropped it and broke! We are disappointed, this was our first Canon....yeah, you guessed it, next Camera will be a different Brand, that's for Sure!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Camera Review
Reviews.Author: David Smith
Reviews.Content: The camera is really compact, easy to carry, easy to use and flexible.  It's easy to just pull the camera out and shoot a picture.  I love the view finder so I don't have to rely on being able to see the image on the screen at the back.  The camera battery life seems to be exceptional.  It's a great camera for everyday picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera for avg person
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use this camera only occasionally, because most other times, I need a camera more quickly, and so I just use my phone. But this is better for on trips when you know you will be taking lots of high quality photos.Pros:-- Relatively easy to use-- Decently sturdy (I dropped it, but seems to function no differently (see below))-- High quality photos-- Can transfer images with SD card or directly from camera with mini USB cord.-- Batter charger compact, easy to use. Red when charging, green when finished.-- Very compact! Fits well into one of the pockets in my purse and will even fit into my pants pocket (those are female jeans, everyone!). Pretty light.-- There are a lot of confusing menus, but I never bothered to read the instruction manual, but I managed to figure out pretty much everything I need regardless. (Pro for ability to figure out w/o reading manual.)Cons:-- Shutter speed to slow to capture movement, and I haven't been able to find a better setting.-- Fragile (I dropped it and got several scratches, but that is to be expected)-- Battery life is not great. Holds full charge for a while, but once it hits less than full battery bars, quick to die.-- Pause between taking picture and returning to screen, but definitely better than other cameras. Takes a while to turn on, same thing.-- Automatic flash is not always reliable, so figure out when to use a flash or not. Recently tried to take a picture of a pond (dark) with turtle (dark) inside of a large restaurant (bright in the background) and could not get the picture to come out. But I may have missed a setting.

Reviews.Title: Still using the camera after 3 years
Reviews.Author: J. Wagner
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it was new about 3 years ago.  I use it all the time, since it's so small and I can carry it wherever I go.  I also have a full size SLR camera, but I find myself taking the PowerShot more because it's just so convenient.  The picture quality is overall very good, though the colors seem a bit bland at times when I compare it to the quality of my SLR.  The HD video is really great, considering the compact size.Speaking of the size, it works great for me because my hands are dexterous.
