If your hands are big or if your fingers are stiff, you might have trouble handling this camera because of its size. The viewfinder is generally useless because its so small, but if you're trying to save battery by avoiding using the display to preview the picture, it can serve its purpose just fine.All in all, if this camera died on me, I'd definitely buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!
Reviews.Author: Melody Spafford "Sunday"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Canon Power Shot SD780 through Amazon.  It was a refurbished camera at Beach Camera. The camera seemed to be a brand new camera and works perfect.  Love the red color and the view finder is handy when it is really sunny.  I had a  Canon Power Shot SD630 and it was awesome but I lost it 4 months ago and it was really depressing not to have it with me always.  The SD780 is close to the SD630 and I am very happy with it.  Nice and tiny to use and carry where ever I go.  After looking at so many cameras, I just seem to love the Canons the best!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Ms. Fee
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this camera. I love everything about it. You can't go wrong with a Canon this is my 3rd one. I just keep upgrading.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: L. A. Olson
Reviews.Content: I'm rugged and have owned several canon point and shoots.  I love the 1400, yet this, the 780, definitely holds it's own.  I've taken incredible photos with it.Love this camera and even with upgraded cameras, I still use this camera sometimes because it is timeless.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: eglen84
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after some extensive shopping around to go on a backpacking trip to the grand canyon and yosemite. It's not an SLR, so anything beyond your standard photos you may find something lacking. However, the image quality is truly extraordinary for such a small camera. I've taken pictures alongside someone with an SLR and for your basic pictures (good lighting, no zoom needed), the image quality was just as good.If it got broken today, I would definitely buy this camera again. I've been using it for several months and have never been unhappy with what this camera has done and I haven't found anything I truly dislike.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MSwamp
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera. It takes great shots, easy to use and does HD video. Only wish it had a Lojack on it...so small it gets lost all the time.

Reviews.Title: i take it everywhere!
Reviews.Author: Kaijin
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nice, fast camera I can put in my pocket every day for all those impromptu times that you wish you had your camera. This is exactly what I wanted! Menu system is great. Shooting modes are great. video is great. Colors are very accurate. I turned off digital zoom as I prefer to do editing work myself. Autofocus does suffer if you turn off the red assistant light. Flash is REALLY harsh, I put a piece of white electrical tape over it, much better now. Battery life is very short. I got some extra batteries to take with me when I know I'm going to do a lot of shooting. Not the best in low light, I spose few cameras are. I really enjoy using my camera often!

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: hutchpeace
Reviews.Content: I like my new camera. I bought it because I wanted a compact camera with a viewfinder, which no one seems to make any more. The camera worked very well and I was able to take lots of pictures.I did have some out of focus shots in low light situations were I could not use flash.My only problem was with the Amazon website.When I tried to use the one click site, there was never a confirmation of purchase, so I closed out and order again and ended up getting two cameras.Amazon did rebate the cost of one camera, but the double mailing charge remained until the retailer removed the charge, which I greatly appreciate.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased. some more options would be nice too
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! I have a canon DSLR but I wanted something smaller and more portable! Well, I found it. The viewfinder is so worth it! I would love if it had a splice feature - I haven't found one yet. Other than that, it has fun options to change colors(sepia, black and white, vibrant, etc), lighting, and where the picture is being taken(programmed settings for indoor, outdoor, nighttime etc settings).The pictures appear to be very nice and I would definitely recommend this over some of the other canon options. The viewfinder is a must for outdoor use!

Reviews.Title: An Amazing camera - especially for the size and price
Reviews.Author: Nicolle
Reviews.Content: This camera has amazing picture taking abilities in all conditions. The flash is brilliant, the very high ISO settings perform beautifully and the color is amazing. I can print 8 X 10 photos from the pictures I take on this camera. and the HD movie feature is awesome. I use it all of the time.

Reviews.Title: Zoom Focus
Reviews.Author: Deborah Norling
Reviews.Content: I owned the Canon SD780 IS for 18 months. Enjoyed using it until the zoom would not operate any longer which produced poor, blurry pictures.  I never dropped the camera and always kept it in a hard-sided case.

Reviews.Title: best digital used to date
Reviews.Author: DonD
Reviews.Content: The only small digital I have found with a viewfinder--its best feature. This is the primary reason I bought it. My photos are much more professional and I don't have to guess at what I am framing, like so many digital cameras with only the LCD.  By using only the viewfinder, I can get twice as many photos as with the LCD. It is extremely lightweight and fits in my smallest pocket. The zoom, located on the shutter button, is much easier to use than the position on my last camera. The only drawback is that the battery has to be removed to be recharged, so buy two batteries and keep the extra charged up. DD

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: alissssa "alissapanda"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to vlog on. I knew it would be a good camera because Charles Trippy uses it. Very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Small and Powerful!
Reviews.Author: Danteny
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Easy to use and you can carry it anywhere!  I still like to look through a view finder.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Little Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: J.M.C. "Daijoubu"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in July of 2009. I take it everywhere and it always takes great shots. It is by far the best point and shoot camera I have ever owned. The SD780is is an excellent value that I would recommend to anyone looking for a small lightweight camera that still takes nice photos.I also bought the waterproof case for this camera and use it on scuba diving trips. I have had it down to 35+ meters many times. It still takes fantastic photos and video!

Reviews.Title: Bought first at Best Buy a year ago- after 3000 clicks I choose to give my Mom the same.
Reviews.Author: SQ
Reviews.Content: Great experience overall. hardly any picture that come out blurred. I first bought this camera from Best Buy and was surprised at the rating of 4.9/5. The price was superb as well, the display large and crisp.I still use the same old camera all the time. My mom recently asked for a camera and I had no other choice but to get her the same. Best Buy doesn't sell it anymore.Learning curve is not too steep.you can play around in the manual setting as well which add flavor to your clicks.This camera has been sharing precious moment of life. and i felt obliged to write about it. & thus my first reviewHD video option is no doubt needs a extra review -  AmazingNB" Only drawback is the camera doesn't take "as" good picture in zoom mode. ( I don't use zoom mode)

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: kaylee
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. Its much better than my last one. This camera is light-weight, easy to use, captures good quality pictures, and its small enough to take with me anywhere.I don't set the camera on flash. I don't like the way the pictures comes out. When I take pictures I always turn off the flash button.Overall, the quality of the pictures are good. Its clear and HD. I will probably be going with canon cameras from now on. Satisfied customer!

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera!
Reviews.Author: Tilo "Zombies Books in order: 1. We're Alive ...
Reviews.Content: Very happy I bought this camera. The red looks great and it slips easily into your jeans pocket. Some say it makes too much noise while filming but I didn't even think about it. Bought it for 169 so I made a good deal, but would still recommend it at 199!

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Marvin Kuers
Reviews.Content: Great camera and fast delivery. Excellent service all the way around. Don't forget to get a memory card - it doesn't come with one.

Reviews.Title: broke soon
Reviews.Author: farnaz
Reviews.Content: The lens broke after a few months. I had to spend $150 to repair the lens. I;m not that happy with the images. They are too bright although I have tried to change the settings to improve it. My husbands iphone takes much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: This thing is a tiny monster!
Reviews.Author: Joey D.
Reviews.Content: The package was all beautiful, except UPS was retarded and delivered my $125 package to the next door neighbor.  Luckily, they were kind and brought it to me.  I opened it and it was beautiful!!  Described precisely in the ad!  I took some test pictures and they were beautiful!  Well, when I 1st took it out, I was holy crud, look at the size of that thing!  It's SO tiny!  I thought my Sony Handycam was small!  It's about the size of a deck of cards... amazing!I was very glad it came with everything it said.  I looked through the package and said "O my gosh, they didn't include a memory card!"  But then I reviewed the ad and it said it didn't so I am surely not holding that up against you.I am extremely happy with all the features on it.  The pictures are BEAUTIFUL!  The video is pretty dang good, but the sound recorder isn't good.  But I don't care because I bought it for the pictures.I am happy that it will fit my tripod so I don't have to hold it ALL the time.I did order a memory card and popped it in and used it and it was very very nice.Very compact, easy to use, figured it out without a manual within 15 minutes.One thing to beware of - this will NOT save pictures unless you have a memory card.  It has absolutely no internal memory.  But I don't mind because I don't need it.  I was just used to my handycam which has 8 gb of internal memory for videos and stills.Thank you very much AV26INC for a beautiful camera for very cheap and keeping your word!  I give this a 5 star rating and I would recommend this camera to everyone and say to buy it from AV26INC.  Thank you!!! :)

Reviews.Title: Like this model canon
Reviews.Author: J. Mattson
Reviews.Content: I had used my daughter's and taken good pictures. She travels a lot and takes amazing pictures even while in a moving car. I do professional photography and have lots of respect for this camera for a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera, and it works very well.Unfortunately, I thought I was supposed to receive a 4GB memory card for the 2 cameras I order as a special, but never received them.

Reviews.Title: Good -- for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Sebastian
Reviews.Content: This is one tiny camera. That being said, don't expect a brilliant lens.The camera is very portable, very sleek, and great build quality. I always shoot with Canon with DSLR's and they do deliver quality. The camera is excellent, and very importantly is compatible with the CHDK. The lens leaves a lot to be desired for in low light conditions. Outdoors or in good lighting the camera shines.The HD video is a nice addition, and the quality is fair. Unfortunately there is almost no compression on the videos so you cannot record for very long unless you have a 8 gig SD card (or larger).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ghumra
Reviews.Content: I am glad I bought this camera, in fact my son choose it after research and reading reviews on line, thanks for all those who put the honest review that helps people like me who do not have time to do researchVideo recording capability in HD is great

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: E. Marks
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photo nut but enjoy recording the family and places we visit. This camera allows for ease of carrying and shooting. It was a good choice for me. I shot most of the 500 pictures taken on vacation in the auto mode. Works for me.

Reviews.Title: CANON CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Frances C Feil
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the price, it's the 2nd one that I have purchased for myself lost my 1st one. Have purchased 4 total 2 for gifts that should tell the story of what I think of it.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera a month and so far I love it.  The picture quality is great.  I haven't learned all the modes, I've been using auto and it's great.I didn't understand why the red one was less expensive.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: B Dimm "Bill"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this purchase. It's very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: The Mariners Fan "Eriko"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a year and I love it, its so simple and easy to use. I have a couple of SLR's at home but I don't always want to lug them around with me, especially on vacation. I picked this camera up because it:1. Has great HD video recording2. Is very small (the size of a credit card and thinner than most people's wallets)3. Takes nice indoor and low light photos4. Simple to use5. Little lag time between photos6. Catches action shots very well7. Syncs well with my MACBookCanon always makes great quality products, their point and shoots are always simple to use and give you a definite bang for your buck. I love the fact I can zoom in while video recording and edit photos on the go. Battery life could be better in my opinion, I usually get 2-3 days before it dies, but it charges up quickly. Photos are clear, crisp but I do notice a loss of clarity if zoomed in while editing. If you want super crisp photos, I'd recommend a Sony. But I highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: does what it is suposed to
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: It is a typical Canon. Nice, pocket-sided, and beautiful red color. I am more of a Nikon fan; however, my boss is a Canon so fan we decided to keep the company with his prefered brand.Pros: Small, good quality photos, camera does everything Canon says it does.Cons: Small buttons don't work well with big fingers, controls can be a little confusing if not used to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived in a timely fashion and product was in perfect condition.  Have taken only a few pictures, but so far they have all come out wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Awesome point-and-shoot camera for the price!! A++
Reviews.Author: Amanda Michelle Lingwall
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this camera. It takes amazing photos and videos and is well worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Jon Looy
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a couple months now and I love it. Image Stabilization is a new thing for me. Needless to say, this is the best camera I've ever owned. Takes great pictures. I'm not sure I'd pay what Amazon is asking for it. I got it for just over $100 which was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: Michael Siesser
Reviews.Content: It is a little bit bulkier than what I had hoped for... but it does take great pictures. It has many different scenes to choose from... very user friendly. I feel like it is well worth the money... especially if you buy it used.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Sarah23
Reviews.Content: This camera is fun and easy to use. great for everyday pictures or quick videos. Just do not drop it because it will brake. Otherwise if you are not a professional photographer and just want to take some fun pictures and maybe add some accent colors or have fun making the sky pink and your dog blue then this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for everyday use!  Always ready!!!
Reviews.Author: bouldec
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  I bought it for my daughter who just turned 19.  She loves it too!  I'm so glad that I bought it!  The price was definitely right and the options exceeded our expectations.  She has a great camera that is going to always be ready for her to roll out and use whenever she needs it in her busy life.  And when she slows down, she'll have some great photos to look at and remember where she's been and what she did!! :-)

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for a better camera
Reviews.Author: Kellybangg
Reviews.Content: Its easy to use, looks great, and it's affordable. I couldn't ask for a better camera. Also the picture quality is great and the macro setting is better than any point and shoot I have waver used

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: T. F. McLaughlin "drifter"
Reviews.Content: It takes the best pictures of any Cannon or Fuji camera we have owned.Simply a great camera.

Reviews.Title: superb
Reviews.Author: cooden
Reviews.Content: bought it for my wife and she absolutely loves it. v easy to operate and cute for a girl

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT SD780IS
Reviews.Author: JulesforU
Reviews.Content: Great camera for someone with limited camera experience.  Easy to use and sharp pictures!

Reviews.Title: nice little portable camera
Reviews.Author: P. Tam
Reviews.Content: Great little point and shoot camera that does pretty good video. Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either. Nice to have a little camera to carry around that shoots decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: A great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Jgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. It's easy to use and easy to download to my computer. The picture is great for a small camera. It's easily transportable and durable.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: boo
Reviews.Content: I love this camera - I have taken quite a few trips with it, the pictures are great.  The zoom video is so easy to use.  I love the color!!!! And I love how tiny it is, how light it is and how it easily fits in my pocket!!!  Best thing I ever bought for myself!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, horrible company
Reviews.Author: DVyas
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera, but it is a really bad company. Canon is the worst company when it comes to getting anything repaired. When I got this camera, I noticed it had a dead pixel on the LCD. I sent it in to Canon, they sent it back not only with the dead pixel unrepaired, but they left dust between the protective screen film cover and the LCD. As a result I sent it to them a second time. When I got it back the second time, they did not fix either problem and they broke something inside the camera so a red spot kept appearing on the LCD when trying to take a picture or shoot video... I sent it in a third last week telling them to fix the problems they caused and to replace the LCD.It returned today, they fixed the two problems they caused, but I still have the dead pixel.The bottom line is Canon is a horrible company when it comes to repair service, if you get a defective LCD like I did, you are going to have to deal with it, because they will lie to you about trying to repair and do nothing.Either Canon lacks integrity or their repair people are incompetent or both (probably both) and thus I have to poorly review their product, because if something else goes defective, I have no guaranteed they will be able to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: This camera is an amazing value for the money.  Takes great pictures, easy to use, long battery life and easy to charge.  Only caution is that the camera does not come with a memory card.

Reviews.Title: great buy!
Reviews.Author: Lauren S.
Reviews.Content: great little camera for the money. i'm surprised to say my favorite feature is the HD video. the biggest downfall with this canon camera (like my previous canon point and shoot) is the time it takes to prepare to take the next picture after you've just taken one. it's very small but still has a nice weight to it so it doesn't feel cheap. i'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Aris
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife for her birthday. She wanted a small compact camera for her purse so she would always have a camera available and ready, especially now what we have a kid. She loves the compact feel, doesn't feel cheap. Solid, takes good pics. Canon makes great stuff!

Reviews.Title: High quality pics with the conveninece of a pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: cct "cct"
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with my camera. I was looking for a good quality one without having to go too crazy .. It is an affordable and easy to carry camera.very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Low Light Master
Reviews.Author: Still Waiting
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for the Canon 1300, 1200, and 780. After much debate between the 3, I finally decided on the 780 because of the compliments it got for its low light performance despite it being a older model. I took this camera for a "photo shoot" at the Huntington Gardens in Pasadena where there was extremely bright light (posted pink flowers) and dark indoor shot opportunities (posted mannequin heads with flower hats). I usually use my Canon SLR, but I was thoroughly impressed by what this little camera can do. The camera seems to adjusts its exposure intuitively.  The flowers I took in the bright light of the desert garden did not come out overexposed.  When I was indoors using no flash with only one spot light from the ceiling on the subject, the pictures actually turned out brighter than when I was looking at it in person. There was minimal noise with sharp focus.  The IS does work! I look forward to playing with it some more.  Still got to test out the macro and the video functions.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Pterra "pterra"
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research on digital cameras in this price range and decided on this one.  I'm glad I did.  This is my first digital camera and I am surprised at how easy it is to use and understand.  The picture quality is way beyond what I anticipated.  I'm very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING!!!
Reviews.Author: Roy A. Mayfield "Rapid Roy"
Reviews.Content: This is one outstanding camera in every way you can imagine. But then, I have come to expect nothing less from the good folks at Cannon.Despite what some of the more negative reviews say. The pictures from this camera are magnificent! (and I have seen Pixs from other brands of point and shoots that are certanly less then satisfying.)This is the first camera I've had with face recognition. So I was impressed when it would detect human faces on the images on the TV screen.It's size is great! And (as the saying goes) I even like the color!!!I whole heartedly recommend this camera!!! To anyone! At any price!

Reviews.Title: Well it just beautiful
Reviews.Author: Satya
Reviews.Content: Just like my old one, which got stolen, but maybe even a little better. I do miss being able to do the color swapping and color accenting with pictures and not just video.

Reviews.Title: Seems a bit flimsy compared with my previous model
Reviews.Author: Tenderfoot
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is quite good with this camera and viewable image is larger but the way its put together seems cheaper and control features are more recessed. Thus, though I don't have large fingers, operating the camera feels a bit clumsy. I'll keep it however.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Doris Ulrich Gerndt
Reviews.Content: I've bought it for my son and he is very happy with the PowerShot camera. It's a wonderfulitem to make quick and brilliant pictures.

Reviews.Title: Little Wizard
Reviews.Author: Thea Cybele
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, amazing quality of video, super long lasting battery, good quality of pictures (especially closeups!). Couldn't ask for more from this little wizard!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD780 IS Camera
Reviews.Author: Felix C. Eneh "Galaxy"
Reviews.Content: The camera is really good. Takes good pictures, although you'd have to manipulate it to stay ready for a shot. User friendly too.

Reviews.Title: kanamaham
Reviews.Author: K. Narasimham "knham"
Reviews.Content: i am really happy of amazon.it brought the item fast&the; packing isimmaculate .i am yet to try all the features.however the camera is nice to hold.i apprecite canon for putting together so many features into a so  small lovely camera.it should be a nice gift.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Moore
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best $200 I've ever spent. Small enough to fit in your pocket and has the best zoom quality I have ever seen on a small camera. I would absolutely recommend this product to everyone. Its easy to use, and takes great photos. If your in the market for a small digital camera, you should definetly buy this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Gaurav Harode "new shopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month back and I love this product. It is the best point and shoot camera in its class. Though its only 3x zoom you do not miss it much. The picture quality makes up for it. Do not expect SLR type quality from this camera. The biggest surprise was the HD video function. IT IS AMAZING!!! I am not a much video fan but since I have had this camera i have become one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Stuff!!!
Reviews.Author: Mohammed A. Rehmatullah
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I had expected. It would have been simply perfect if it had a better capability of shooting panorama shots and shots in the dark.

Reviews.Title: everything I hoped for
Reviews.Author: Matthew Kevin Conte
Reviews.Content: sometimes it takes a few tries to get sharp action photos on auto mode, but you can set it up manually if you plan to take a lot of action shots or just need to make the first one good...otherwise fantastic all around

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bynum Henson
Reviews.Content: The first thing that "hits you" is the small size of this camera.  It takes amazingly high quality pictures, and is quite an improvement over my old SD1000. I highly recommend to anyone looking for an "aim and shoot".  It also takes nice video, and they play back on your television from the camera (cable included).

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Sarah E. Phelan "Mrs. Cullen"
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this camera. It is very user friendly for a novice. It takes great pictures and I have no complaints about it at all. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and takes great shots & video
Reviews.Author: Bob T
Reviews.Content: We love this camera.  Not just for stills, the video is amazingly good.  Photo quality is excellent in all kinds of conditions.  Fits the hand perfectly with a feel of quality.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: B. Jones
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to NYC during the winter and it was perfect. Since it was freezing, I wanted to keep my hands in my pockets as much as possible. This camera is so small, it fit perfectly in my jacket pocket (w/ my hand). Whenever I wanted to take a quick pic,  I was able to whip it out of my pocket, take the pic, and stick it back in my pocket (w/ my cold hand) in record time. It takes great pictures and video. Love it! I also got many compliments on the black color.

Reviews.Title: I like it!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lina P. Crespo "Pili"
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice, and the shipping was on time.Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT !!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Sunnyat8pm
Reviews.Content: THE BEST CAMERA!!!  I did alot of research before this purchase.  I had a Canon SD110 for 5 years and used it at least 5 times a week.  This camera is everything an amateur could want at a reasonable price.  I am very happy with it and it is easy to use.  Point and click...can't go wrong !!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Kuo "Moo"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera!  the HD video quality is pretty darn good, most people are surprised that the video I shot came out of this tiny little camera.  The price is decent and it works great.  I had a sony before that cost me an arm and a leg...  never again!

Reviews.Title: fits in my shirt pocket and is a great camera
Reviews.Author: George Tausiani
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good camera that didn't require me to carry a case and this one fit the bill.  Did the research on these "ultra compact" cameras and this one had high ratings on most sites I checked.  The performance, battery life is excellent and the picture quality is outstanding.  I do use a DSLR for special occasions, but for just snapshots, vacation pics, and enjoying life...this is the camera.  It fits in my shirt pocket!....Just a great little camera all around...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Fred S. Rolater
Reviews.Content: The Cannon 780s is a very fine point and shoot camera with extra features.  The quality of the pictures is really good.  The size is amazingly small and light, easy to carry around in your pocket.  My wife who loves to take pictures but is not very adaptable to complex cameras finds this one very easy to use.  The extra features of a viewfinder and movie capability also make this camera stand out.

Reviews.Title: Excellent compact digital camera with 720p HD video
Reviews.Author: Jitendra Patil
Reviews.Content: Liked the compactness of the camera that can take quality photos as well as 720p HD videos. I was looking for something that can fit in my pocket and can shoot high quality photo or video. SD780IS fulfills my requirements.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD780is Review
Reviews.Author: Hector F. Lara "Hector Fernando"
Reviews.Content: This Camera has far exceeded my expectations.  When I purchased this camera I did not think much of its so called HD video filming.  That is of course until I saw the results.  I hooked it up to my 32" tv with an HDMI and the picture was so beautiful and crisp with exceeding details.I carry this camera with me all the time now, hoping to film anything that I can.  It's a joy to watch whatever I can record.The microphone on this tiny thing is super impressive, picks up sound with great detail.  You can even zoom while you are filming, a feature absent from other digital camera models.The video quality is much better than an actual Video camera which my girlfriend bought for $350.It's also amazing how small this thing is. I keep it in my pocket and it feels like a cellphone.The battery life is also a wonder, I took a bunch of pictures and filmed about 25-30 minutes worth of video throughout one day and the battery was still at 3 bars.  Amazing!!The only thing this thing doesn't have is manual focus which is pretty much native to SLR's anyway.This is some great BANG for the BUCK. I would definitely buy this one again.I would give this thing a 9/10 just because I know there is always room for improvement, wouldn't wan Canon to stop trying to improve their cameras.

Reviews.Title: bang for buck > than expectatons
Reviews.Author: Christopher C. Williams "monkey54it"
Reviews.Content: um, this camera is wicked awesome. video out to tv via hdmi? check. Auto settings and a wide range of presets for camera pics? check. Under 200$? check. good picture for video and pic quality is good as well? check. people have stated that the audio from the video may not be the best BUT: i had to take video of an error message on a data center floor. Upon playback i could hear myself over the blaring fans of 100,000 devices in the background. let me stop here and advise that i havent had a camera since the disposables(film) came out, but i really think for 200$ this is a great buy. easy to use, plenty of settings, extremely portable. whats not to like? make sure you grab a class 4 or higher sdhc card with your purchase, as well as a mini hdmi -> hdmi cable for your video out.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jan Di Gann
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my daughter's Xmas present & she almost didn't get it because I wanted to keep it for myself. Its small & sexy with a large viewing area. Our family always uses cannon cameras & we love them.Super fast service. I received it more quickly than I thought was possible, especially at Xmas.

Reviews.Title: Nice little Camera
Reviews.Author: Cristian A. Rodriquez "Grapho"
Reviews.Content: Very stylish, compact and the shots look great. The video is also petty good considering that it is a secondary function.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BMS "BMS"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my sister at Amazon. It is great compact camera with all features. I previously have Canon S3 its bulky. so this time bought light weight camera with all features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, not a great video recorder
Reviews.Author: TA
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Very small. Very good Quality pictures. The video sucks because of the fact that it pics up very little audio, ever from a person only a two to three feet away. Even me holding the camera and talking from at the most a foot between the camera and my face, it was hard to hear and understand what i was saying (and this is indoors in a room with no other sound other than the person i am recoding and myself speaking). Great camera for photos though. If you just need pictures i would highly recommend it. If you need a somewhat decent video recorder, do not get this with that aspect in mind. Also, i bought it refurbished from a person on amazon, and i couldn't even tell it was a referb in any way at all. Looked brand new.

Reviews.Title: Powershot review
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Ruddick
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money. It is quite small and appears well built. Picture quality in normal conditions is quite good. We are not camera experts. The only con is small dial for selecting features. Others have noted this. Hopefully Canon will take note.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: David Pease "drp"
Reviews.Content: Does everything it says it will and does it well. This is a great camera for close to medium range shots, when traveling you can take great stills and very good HD video. Only thing I would fix would be the ability to zoom optically when in video mode. If you want a small camera that captures HD video .... buy this one SD780IS. Got this from Amazon $[...] bucks cheaper than any other retailer or on-line vendor $[...]... WOW!!! Also bought the 8gb sdhc class 6 memory card.

Reviews.Title: VERY SURPRISED That the video capabilty sealed the deal!
Reviews.Author: wwireless
Reviews.Content: I purchased my SD780is on Amazon just before black Monday for $169 (that price only lasted 24 hours)! I looked at MANY different cameras before purchasing. I wanted something that took great pictures and was easy to use. This camera gave me both. This camera is super small and it slips into my jeans pocket easily so I carry it much more than any other camera I've ever had.If you want to go full manual it's got that capacity but I've been shooting virtually all auto and I'm pleased with the results. The long shutter lag-time (the time it takes from when you push the shutter button till when the picture is actually taken) frustrated me on my old point-and-shoot but this camera's shutter lag is very short.The interesting thing was the video aspect. I really had no desire to shoot video with any point-and-shoot that I was about to buy. I have a video camera and figured that I'd buy a new one sometime later. Then I noticed that the SD780is shoots video in HD where others in it's price range did not. I no longer shoot a lot of video but figured this camera might be able to do both. I'm very happy with the video I've shot and believe it's picture quality is superior to my actual video camera. No more of those little tapes either!If you do intend to shoot much video buy at least an 8Gig SDHC memory card (better yet a 16Gig) and DON'T BUY IT ON eBAY. Lot's of angry buyers that ended up with 3Gig cards marked as 16Gig purchased from Chinese sellers.

Reviews.Title: Replaced the Canon SD400 that I lost
Reviews.Author: D. Olsby
Reviews.Content: It seemed tragic to lose my trusted SD400 that took such great pictures, but the SD780 is so much better!  It really does it all, from crystal clear stills to surprisingly good HD video.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera with HD video.
Reviews.Author: Wen-chun Cheng
Reviews.Content: My SD750 was dropped to the floor and the lens cover is broken. So, I got a chance to look around for a new camera. It comes down to ZS3, SD780IS, SD960IS, but end up with SD780IS mainly because size, capability HD, good indoor shot quality, and the price is pretty good.The result is great, better photo quality compared to SD750, but video quality is much better. And it felt very small in hands, and fit very comfortably in jean's pocket. And one bonus I got is I can reuse almost everything from SD750.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!!
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with this camera. It's very small and sleek and takes great pictures. It seems very durable and not cheaply built like other cameras.  I was taking picutres all day and the battery was still half way full. This camera also shoots HD video and the quality is better compared to the nikon coolpics. If you shoot alot of video consider buying a bigger storeage sd card. I have one 8 gig and 2 gig and lasts me all day.  This camera has many great features and a very nice LCD. It even has a tiny viewfinder. I highly recommand this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for those times you need a quick picture
Reviews.Author: Glenn A. Miller "Programmer/Architect"
Reviews.Content: I'd been using my iPhone for pictures of whiteboard sessions around the office. I'd take them and send them to SharePoint. (A lot of work goes into some of those sessions, eh?)The quality of an iPhone snap isn't the greatest. I looked at reviews for small, dense cameras at a reasonable price and this one bubbled up to the top.I've been using it more than a month and it takes an excellent snap. No blurry stuff in the results. Great lighting. Very easy to manage photos, including uploading, posting and deleting from the camera.The best part is I can slip it in a pocket until I need it. Very handy!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: BethanyRose
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome - I don't even know where to start.  The picture quality is awesome - takes great pictures in any lighting.  The color is great and the picture is clear.  It's small enough to fit in a small clutch so I can always bring it out with me, even if I'm not carrying a big purse.  The battery lasts FOREVER.I like taking black & white and sepia pictures - this camera is nice because it has 2 photo "modes" (if that's the right word to use).  I have the first set to take normal pictures and the 2nd set on black & white.. so if I ever want to switch to taking a black and white or sepia picture, I just flip a switch and I'm in the 2nd mode in no time.  Likewise, if I decide I want or don't want a flash, the flash is very easy to quickly turn on and off.As with all cameras, you have to read the manual to learn how to use all the features and get the very most out of your camera, but most things are self-explanatory and VERY easy to use.  I use a LOT of the features on this camera.The video is HD quality (I believe)...so when I take video to watch on our big HD tv, I leave it in HD mode.  However, I lessen the quality sometimes because my computer has a hard time keeping up with the quality and speed of the video...I also recommend the accessory pack that comes with the extra battery and the case - not necessary, but they've definitely come in handy.  Get the case so your screen doesn't get scratched in your pocket or your purse!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Anshoo Kumar "ARK2008"
Reviews.Content: Very handy specially for travel purpose.Good Things:1. compact good for travelling2. good picture quality if taken on large setting3. Quickly configures to any computer and ready to download picture in secondsCaution:If the picture setting is not Large the pictures you take will not be high quality I discovered this after using my camera for 6-7 months.  This will reduce the total number of pictures you can take

Reviews.Title: Great camera for under $200
Reviews.Author: BW "Brian wed hoops"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for Christmas and so far it is one of the best cameras I have used.  The picture quality is great and the video for such a small camera is amazing.  I recomend the vivid setting for outdoor photgraphs.  I highly recommend this for anyone who wants a camera under $200.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. T. Jackson "Blacksmoke06"
Reviews.Content: i love this camera! years ahead of my Nikon coolpix. nice screen, very small body, and great picture taking. Canon by far is the leader in point and shoot. still trying to learn the funtions but pretty easy to figure out.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Maricela Medrano
Reviews.Content: Thsi is a very practical cammera that takes excellent pictures. I got this for my son and he loves it!!  It is amaising that such an small cammera can have such a great resolution. Definitly a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: A. Sanders
Reviews.Content: Overall, pleased with this camera.  Portability is great.  Picture quality not as good when zoomed in.  My first video seemed a bit "jerky" and not very smooth.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: J. K. Fowlkes "Keith"
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely amazed by this little camera!  The photos are great but the HD video is absolutely astonishing!!!  Great aluminum body and feels very sturdy.  Fast action for a point and shoot.  Works great with my Mac and the video quality off the camera is just great.Can't go wrong with this one or with Canon in general.  Had problems with a previous 4 year old camera and their service was immediate.Canon, you are one of my favorite companies!!!  Great camera and great price!

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot DS 780IS
Reviews.Author: B. Kramer "Bobbi"
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony digital camera which I absolutely loved, but it was big and bulky and I wanted a smaller camera that was easier to take around--something I could just slip into my purse. My daughter had an older version of this camera and loved it, and the reviews on line were really good, so I bought it. Well, the size is definitely a plus. It is nice and small and fits easily into my small purse, even with the case I bought with it. Without the case, it can fit into my jeans pocket. However I am very disappointed in the video part of the camera. I realize it takes HD video, and that HD takes up more space and takes longer to upload, so I turned the HD off, since I mostly want my video clips for uploading onto the computer and do not care if they are in HD or not, but even lowering the size, it takes SO LONG to upload even the shortest video clip (1-1 1/2 min. clip takes a good 8-10 min or longer to upload) that its almost not worth it. Taking videos also totally drains the batteries. I bought a second battery, that I keep with me all the time. Since I love taking videos of my grandson to send to relatives on the computer, unfortunately this camera is not really what I want it to do. So unless I am doing something wrong when I am uploading (don't know how I could possibly be tho!) then I am disappointed in that part. As for the digital pictures though, they are great. So I will most likely keep the camera. Now I am looking at possibly buying myself a small video camera to supplement this camera. Any thoughts anyone?

Reviews.Title: Very comfortable, good Flip replacement, fast, good images
Reviews.Author: Ilya Vedrashko
Reviews.Content: If you are thoughtful about quality of your photographs and plan to shoot things like sporting events in a badly lit gym, you probably won't want the SD 780 as your only camera. Then again, you wouldn't want any point-and-shoot as your only camera.  On the other hand, if you need something to take on vacation, or something to have in your back pocket when you are outside with your kids and don't want to miss anything, or are looking for an alternative to Flip, you can't go wrong with the SD780.Already an owner of a large DSLR coupled with a heavy lens, I was looking for something that would 1) produce acceptable pictures under regular conditions, 2) replace a Flip cam for shooting video, 3) always stay in the pocket in that unassuming way a good cell phone does, and 4) cost under $300.  I've looked at and tried pretty much the entire Digital Elph line-up, and also seriously considered a Lumix because of their awesome wide angle lenses, but ultimately decided SD 780 was pretty much what I needed.I've owned the camera for a couple of weeks, and here are some first impressions.1) The video is great -- much better than the old non-HD Flip. It seems that I shake the camera more than Flip because of its design, but, and that was a nice surprise since you can't see it in the product shots, the Elph has a tripod mount.  The file sizes are an order of magnitude larger, however, so stock up on a decent and fast (class 6) memory card right here on Amazon for about $15 for 8 Gigs.2) The image quality is what you would expect from a camera of this class. Pictures are great in a perfect light, and not so great in all other light conditions. I haven't seen a point-and-shoot that performs otherwise.3) Given a choice between a couple of random extra features and smaller size, I would always go for the size. None of these extras make your pictures look significantly better, but a constantly bulging pocket is a major annoyance. This camera is very small. I have large hands (I'm 6'2"), and the small buttons haven't been a problem. The camera is also very pleasant to hold and look at.4) Fast start-up time. Shutter lag is ok. There are other point-and-shoot cameras with much higher frame-per-second numbers. If you are considering one of those pocket-sized Lumix cameras, Lumix are slower.5) The other non-Elph camera I looked at was a Canon Powershot SX10IS with the crazy 20x optical zoom (28-560mm equivalent). The SX10IS is bigger, more expensive, and doesn't have HD video, but if you are into stuff that requires powerful zoom, SD780 won't cut it.On the downside, the lack of manual controls is a complete waste.  Also, does anyone ever use that tiny optical viewfinder on this thing? And why can't they name their cameras in a way that doesn't remind an alphanumerical soup?Overall, SD780 is great at what it's been designed to do. Manual controls and even a slightly wider lens would've earned it five stars in its class.

Reviews.Title: SD780IS Review
Reviews.Author: Shawn Cheng "Shawnye"
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great. I went to a couple concerts and took some great HD video. I also was able to take some great photos. I don't think there is a better point and shoot camera on the market right now. It's like having a Flip and SD canon camera all in one. Canon for the most part has always had great support for their products.

Reviews.Title: Compact Love
Reviews.Author: A. Larson "ACo."
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD780IS12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Black)Fantastic camera for the price. If you're a photo hound and love the accessibility of a small camera, this is the joint for you! Takes great HD video and really decent 12MP photos. Fewer settings make it that much easier to use. It's size is PERFECT for travel - fits in your pocket as if it isn't even there.One recommendation is to go with a 16GB or higher memory card as the HD video takes up space quickly.Overall, love this camera! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: carolw
Reviews.Content: Great camera, purchased at the recommendation of a friend. We love the many features that make taking good pictures a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Great pics and video
Reviews.Author: Ali Rizvi
Reviews.Content: My son is turning four and I wanted to get an HD video camera to capture his funny antics. I already had a nice Panasonic 8mm tape camcorder but for a variety of reasons rarely used it. The 780 is a perfect fit for me. It replaces my older powershot for photos and I can take decent HD videos too that I can immediately play back on my 52" Samsung HDTV. I found indoor low light performance to be quite acceptable with some graininess. Mind you my old 8mm camcorder's video quality is better than the HD video from this camera but the pros outweigh the cons. The one area where I see lots of room for improvement is when the video blurs as you move the camera itself quickly. Very slow movement is OK. The 12 megapixel pics are great but I expect them to be anyway. I'm taking a lot of videos now because its fun, super convenient, form factor is not at all intimidating and I can play back, record, upload with ease. It was funny though to see this very tiny camera perched on top of my big tripod at a recent family event. The 2-in-1 camera/camcorder convergence is a must have for me. I just could never lug around a camcorder in addition to a camera. The other tools I paid for are Quicktime pro for easy as ABC splitting/joining of (.mov) video files that this camera produces and Vimeo for uploading HD videos to share with family. Very happy with this Amazon purchase.

Reviews.Title: Still a winner --- stylish, sturdy, sufficiently versatile.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: [SNB 3/3/13:  I've come to regard the Canon SD780 as the closest of all Elves to a Canon "classic."  Look at any of 10-12 Canon Elf models that have succeeded: you won't find any with smaller dimensions that the SD780, which is the smallest Elf ever released by Canon; moreover, you won't find any with a viewfinder, that lifesaver when, in direct sunlight, the picture on the camera's screen washes out. In spite of its tiny size, the SD780 has one.  Moreover, it has every other feature that a true camera lover could want--HD video (with decent audio), complete automation or, if you prefer, a generous selection of settings from which the user can choose to match virtually any subject under any lighting conditions.  When the form-fitting camera especially designed for the SD780 is ordered Canon PSC-1050 Deluxe Leather Case (Red).  What it's lacking--internet and social connectivity--is, for some of us, another reason to prefer this camera over any "smart phone" (I simply can't take seriously a camera that looks like a driver's license or credit card.  Treat this camera nicely, and it'll return the favor for another 5-10 years.]Original review:  Canon released its new line into a tough market with economic hard times and a glut of consumer hand-held devices, so if you can resist all the graduation and Father's Day hype, this one, like its predecessor the SD770, is likely to come down in price (same for the SD1200).  For those who like the practicality and convenience of a slightly larger camera offering more aspect ratios, the SD880 and SD890 are understandably better bets.  Wide angle lenses may not excite some consumers as much as a zoom lens, but they're far more practical for tight framing of group shots, not to mention insuring the mic picks up dialog during videos.But the SD780 is a camera where looks, though not the only thing, aren't far from being the main thing.  The camera feels even smaller than its listed dimensions and weight; the carton it comes in is 3/5 the size of the box for its predecessor, the SD770.  And just compare the surfaces of these two cameras: not a speck of space is wasted on the SD780, making the viewfinder a bit slower to deploy and the flash slightly less powerful than either of these features on the SD770.  But no question that, assuming you don't miss the classic Canon squared-off look, the SD780 is a sexy-looking, stealthy (especially in black) point 'n shooter that's as aesthetically pleasing and as well designed as an iPod Nano  (just be careful not to put either device into a pants pocket without first checking for holes).  As for size, my Sony Cybershot U-10 is fatter but 30 percent smaller overall than the SD780, so best to regard this one not as the smallest camera but the smallest Canon.Initial impressions of the shots are favorable. The ones from my Canon PowerShot model with a mere 3.2 megapixel lens set up faster and strike me as more natural, but I'd hate to crop or enlarge any of them.  The SD780 invites the user to exercise patience as well as creativity in order to get the most from its extreme miniaturization.  I haven't tried attaching an HDMI cable to this pint-sized overachiever as yet, but I expect to do so and return to this review in the near future, hopefully with some sort of assurance that carrying this little marvel will save you the trouble of bringing along a Flip to your granddaughter's ballet recital or son's Little League game.

Reviews.Title: Beware price gougers!
Reviews.Author: Micah
Reviews.Content: This camera sold for one hundred fifty new, yet some crazy fools are trying to sell to unwitting customers for three times that or more.  Please research before you buy.  This camera is worth less than a hundred bucks today.This is otherwise a nice little pocket camera.  However it has been superseded by newer models with higher resolution sensors, less noise, and SDXC compatibility.  Don't ripped off by buying one for four hundred.

Reviews.Title: Ok for facebook photos outside, but makes sacrifices to reach it's size
Reviews.Author: W. Gayther
Reviews.Content: Things I liked:- It's size- It's quick startup time- It's quick autofocus (shutter lag) time - first pocket camera I've had where the shutter lag started to border on "I didn't even notice it"- Real nice colors in the photos I tookThings I didn't like:- It's small, but weighs enough to still be noticeable. The listed weights don't back me up, but it felt like it weighed more than the sd1200 in my pocket.- Resolution - despite being rated 12 megapixels, I got slightly *less* detail out of it in sunny conditions than I got out of my 5 megapixel kodak point and shoot that I bought 5 years ago for like [...].- Things in the middle of a picture have the same detail as my 5mp kodak, but things around the edges are notably fuzzier and blurrier.- Got a couple of out of focus shots even in bright daylight- To be fair, it did do better in low light than my kodak, taking clearer and more color-accurate shots than my kodak in my apartment with the lights on.If you've read the Consumer Reports review, it suggested this camera had really good ISO (low light perfomance). It's rather misleading. I bought this camera hoping it had really good night shots - they were just as crap-tastic as other point and shoots that fit in your pocket. Even with lighting directly above them, I could not get a non-blurry picture of my friends at night without a flash. If I used a flash, it tended to give me the typical "faces way white and washed out" look.I noticed while noise is technically well controlled, what happens is that the darker and higher the iso for the shot, the more smudgy and less detailed the photo gets. I mean, I thought they did a nice job at it - I didn't get that "lots of noise" look to my darker photos. But those photos also clearly lost some resolution.If you're looking for resolution in your photos from the 12mp rating, or are excited about the supposed high ISO rating, this camera will be a disappointment. Even buying just a *slightly* larger camera like the SD1200 will likely (based on my shots + online sample photos) give you more resolution and slightly better low light performance, though the noise removal on this camera is pretty nice (perhaps the sd1200 will get replaced with a camera with the same processor as this one) but results in reduced resolution rather than additional noise in your photo. If you just want a tiny point and shoot to take pics to put on facebook, this camera is a very nice option. But I think the physically slightly bigger cameras are a noticeable step up in image detail over this tiny, tiny one.

Reviews.Title: Great but hard to use
Reviews.Author: C. Gray
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my wife for her birthday. Overall the camera works well and the small viewfinder is handy if it's too bright outside to see the screen.  The small size of the camera (smaller than a deck of cards) was great per she tucks it into her jean's pocket to carry it. The camera has a minimal lag time to take a photo and repeat shots.  Overall the picture quality is good and the camera had high ratings by an independent consumer research agency.The biggest annoyance is that when downloading pictures to your computer it saves all of the pictures by date. For example, all of the pictures you took on 5/18/2010 will be in one folder, then all of the pictures you took on 5/19, 5/20 and 5/21 will all be in their own separate own file folders. It would be far easier have the option to group all of the photo's together into one event (i.e. May 2010 trip to beach)  To correct you then have to go into windows manager and re-categories/re-arrange the photo's.  The operating manual suggests that this might be able to be changed but it is not easy to do if it is at all.The second biggest annoyance is that you cannot upload photos directly from the camera to a website like I-photo or [...]. The software forces you to first download the photo's to your PC then upload them to the website, unless you use Cannon's own photo website. To circumvent this we tried to take the SDHC card out of the camera and put it into the combo disk drive on our computer to upload the photos from the drive to the internet. We were unable to do this, not sure if it's the drive that malfunctioning or if the camera somehow prevents you from doing this by the format is saves the pictures in.Overall, great compact camera and I think it was good for the price we paid. My wife does not like it because it is not easy to upload photos to a non cannon website like her clunky old Olympus camera was.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a new camera? Not anymore.
Reviews.Author: Bob Mackie!
Reviews.Content: It's 2010. You want a new point and shoot camera.You want it small -- like fit in pocket without a bulge small. Like shirt pocket small. Like little purse small. Like cell phone small. Or even smaller than these new sidekicks.You also want simplicity. A simple camera. Point and shoot, baby. Like giving it to Grandma to take a photo of you wearing her moo-moo. Like hanging-out-in-Missouri-and-you-want-the-yokel-next-to-you-to-take-your-picture simple.  Yeah, that simple.But you want quality, too. 12 megapixel quality. Not have to worry about blurry photos quality. Print quality.And, you think to yourself, wouldn't it be cool if it shot video. Like real usable video. Like HD video.Well, here you go. This canon fits these qualifications.Stop yakking on and asking questions. It doesn't do flippin' tricks, people. It isn't going to make your marriage any better. (But you can take cool pictures of yourself on your couch.) It's not going to make your kids look any cuter. Trust me, they be ugly. But at least you can print out the photos yourself on a Canon Pixma and nobody has to look at that creature you call a kid.It's just a damn good camera.Postscript: The video is definitely grainy in darker settings. Grainier than a non-HD Flip camera I have. But in the daytime or well lighted rooms? Crisp man. Like a good pilsner.Postscript #2: It's now 6 months later and I lost my camera in some scrub brush while riding drunk on a 4-wheeler. So.... I decided to upgrade to the SD1400is. It's basically  the same camera only very slightly bigger and has two extra camera modes (fishbowl and miniature). I've noticed photos, esp at night, come out better with the 1400is, but it might just be me. If both are the same price, I'd get the 1400is but I wouldn't pay too much more for it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ean E.
Reviews.Content: Just go to auto mode and shoot away. One of the smartest Auto modes I've used in any camera. Picture is kind of grainy at 100% but who cares. I don't upload 4000x3000 images anyway. Great, solid feel. Buttons are small but still very much usable.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: DZrad "DZrad"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is awesome!  It fits great in my purse, it takes beautiful pictures and videos and is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: K. kilker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for a travel camera, I'm not a pro photographer so all the techno mumbo means nothing to me.... the end product (pictures and video) is outstanding for any size camera and when you consider it's small size! wow!

Reviews.Title: Perhaps the most complete pocket camera ever made
Reviews.Author: F. Donald Ahee "donahee"
Reviews.Content: How can something this small do so many big things. I put a 16GB card in it and wow! An hour & a half of HD video? Thousands of 12 mega-pixel photos? I took it to a Eric Clapton/Steve Winwood concert and came home with a lifetime treasure of concert movies. I'll leave the hyper technical stuff to other reviewers.This thing is so cool it's like a little dog you can use to introduce yourself to girls! "Oohhh it's so cute"...

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Belleza
Reviews.Content: Camera is excellent for the price I got it.  Take beautiful picture in the daytime as well as the nighttime.  The video cam feature is top notch as well.  Really happy with this product!!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect truly portable memory maker
Reviews.Author: S. Chiu "S C"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted an HD camcorder, but haven't gotten one due to prices, the fact I would need to buy a new computer to process the AVCHD files, and the nagging voice of reason that told me I wouldn't use it as much as I think I would (based on my past experience with a Sony Handycam gathering dust in the closet). But I knew I needed something to capture my daughter's moments. So far, I've been suffering through using the standard dev video on my Panasonic point and shoot which hasn't been a bad experience, but the video quality can get quite dismal. So I started shopping for the new compact "pocket" camcorders ala Flip Mino HD and Creative Vado HD. After days of procrastination, ordered up a Vado for larger hard drive size, larger viewing screen, and cheaper price. Then I learned that the new point and shoots produce HD video. After cursing myself for my failed research, I went down to Best Buy and picked up the Canon SD780. I didn't think I would keep the Canon just because I didn't need another point and shoot but once I did a side by side video comparison with the Vado, it was a no brainer. The video colors from the Canon were more vibrant especially in lower light. The Canon also picked up sound much much better than the Vado which made people sound like they were far and tinny. In the end, the Canon won out and I have absolutely no regrets. It fits in the pocket nicely and is easy to manage. The still pictures are high quality Canon photos and having the still picture functionality is just an added bonus for me.

Reviews.Title: Look elsewhere. Least favorite digital camera we ever had.
Reviews.Author: calendarboy
Reviews.Content: Previously had two Canon PowerShot cameras. My wife was so disappointed with this one that she just quit using it. It was very difficult to use. She has small hands but she still felt the buttons were too small to easily use. But, the truth was that this camera mystified both of us. Yes, it was overly difficult and awkward to use, but we just couldn't put our fingers on why it was so awful.It ended up being just a complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Pass on this
Reviews.Author: Antoinette N. Kaplan "na"
Reviews.Content: With the added phones with cameras the small point and shots are too slow. I actually purchased a Lumix at half the price.It takes regular batteries and takes pictures with better speed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Alana
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 2 years now. It is an excellent camera. It is the smallest I've seen that still takes fabulous, focused, vivid photos. That being said, 2 years ago I paid less than $200 for this camera and now it's $400, which is a bit pricey.  But, if you can get a deal, it is an excellent camera and I highly recommend it as a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: CANNON POWERSHOT SD780IS
Reviews.Author: sunshine4u
Reviews.Content: I HAVE HAD 4 CANON CAMERAS AND EACH 1 IS WORTH WHAT EVER THEY COST !! I LOVE THE SIZE THE VIEWFINDER IS WHAT I LOVE AND EASY TO USE AND UNDERSTAND. IF YOU HAVE NEVER HAD A CANON DON'T BE AFRAID TO TRY ONE.

Reviews.Title: Aweful Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: janechii
Reviews.Content: The purpose of point and shoot is for people who really dont know how to take photos. It should automatically make photos look decent by default! This one wont do that for you. Photos on default settings on automatic mostly comes out crappy. I used to have SD600/630 series and the photos would come out just beautiful, so it cant be me that's taking crappy photos.The manual controls may be good, i have no idea, i dont know how to use it.find another camera if you're a beginner who just wants P&S.;

Reviews.Title: Amazed by the quality!
Reviews.Author: Maryland Mom "sandiego-sam"
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that I really like this camera, which I have had for over a year, I recently saw a new quality in it.  I lost it nine days ago, and it was found outside.  Having been under 4 inches of snow for about 4 days, and two days of rain, I had no hope of it still working.  However, much to my delight and surprise, it still works perfectly.  It was in a case, but it was not water tight.  Very impressed!

Reviews.Title: Really a 4.5 star review - ding for trueness of color and low light blur.
Reviews.Author: CynBio
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, but it's not quite as true to real life color as my older Powershot, and it blurs super easily at anything below full light, unless you use the flash.  Also, resolution could be better at a distance, oddly enough, though the Macro function provides great resolution up close.  Many of these issues could probably be fixed by anyone willing to take the time to really work with the camera, but if you're like me - looking for a point-and-shoot camera - you don't want to take that time or trouble.  My previous Powershot was more lazy-friendly in that respect.This camera does earn serious points for incredible battery life, even on non-Canon batteries, and for shockingly good HD video!  I had no expectations for that feature, and have been blown away by how nicely it films.  The audio isn't even bad.  I use a four year old full-size Sony digital camcorder to film behavior in the lab, but may switch over to using this camera instead - it's really that good.Finally, as others have already pointed out, it's ridiculously portable.  I haven't even scratched the screen yet, which is impressive, as I've carried it everywhere for about six months.  All-in-all, 4.5/5 stars.  There's room for improvement in long-range picture quality, but I'd definitely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: RaeK
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good little compact camera, this is a good camera for the price.  This is the first canon I have purchased, however my daughter has owned and suggested that I buy a canon.  This was a good decision love my camera, have a granddaughter and needed to take snapshots!!

Reviews.Title: Love it Love it Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mommyshopper
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon and the best yet.  It is beautiful and it takes beautiful pictures and VIDEOS.  The video quality of great - we don't use a camcorder anymore.  I LOVE this camera.  It is easy to use, it's compact, and it is simply beautiful.

Reviews.Title: MUST be faulty unit, can't be this bad.  NO macro capability.
Reviews.Author: B. Dunn "b."
Reviews.Content: I must have gotten a faulty unit because it has no macro capability, won't focus up close at all.  I tried all the different settings to make sure, and it MUST be broken.  Otherwise, it is crap.  Let's see how difficult it is to return it and get one that actually works.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD780IS 12.1MB digital camera
Reviews.Author: sammyboy
Reviews.Content: The size is FANTASTIC! The picture quality is great. Downloading is a breeze. We love it! Thanks to Canon for always making winner cameras.

Reviews.Title: nice camera for beginners.
Reviews.Author: Percy Azofeifa Diaz "pmazofeifa"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for a person who wants to take nice pictures without too much knowledge.

Reviews.Title: best camera i've had yet
Reviews.Author: C.E. "Frank"
Reviews.Content: camera is really small and compact, the 3x zoom isn't impressive but it's only for taking pictures with your friends. The HD video is good! 720p, the microphone isn't as great as others though, I suggest getting a Flip if your looking for recording video.Features?not too many...my aunt has a sony cybershot and it's loaded with features,BUT, i believe canon has way better picture quality,there is almost no shutter lag but focusing it may take a secondthat's all for now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tera A. Leverenz
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. If your wanting a fun little camera to travel with or take pictures of friends this is it. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: W. Ridge
Reviews.Content: I love the portability of this camera and coupled with it's easy to use functionality, I can carry it anywhere and take amazing pictures with easy. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Get this model if you can
Reviews.Author: Camera Bug
Reviews.Content: This is not the current model and that is why I bought it. The new model does not have an optical viewfinder which I really wanted because I use the camera in bright light often without reading glasses.

Reviews.Title: an excellent camera with cell-phone size
Reviews.Author: Hugh John
Reviews.Content: I don't know a lot of terms wrt camera -- what I can say about this camera is that it gives good images as well as good video, and I just put it in my pocket just like the way I put my cell -- yes, NO camera bag needed -- and I don't recall when I charged the battery -- it must be a while back ago

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Expert Analyst "Solomon"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of its price, I'm keeping it because of its ease of use and great pictures.  It came with an A-DATA memory card, which was a steal!

Reviews.Title: Takes great picture with vivid color, easy to use, but focus and zoom lags
Reviews.Author: Mina
Reviews.Content: I generally like this digital camera.  It is for sure money-well-spent.  It takes very clear and good pictures.  The color is vivid and it is also fun to play around with the functions considering this camera is under $200!!! It is also petite-ly cute! One thing I have to say though is that the zoom and focus tends to lag a little bit.  Also, maybe it's just me, but in between taking pictures, the camera kept saying "busy" which at first I thought it was broken but I guess just it is just taking time to re-adjust the lens.

Reviews.Title: I love the small size and features!
Reviews.Author: a_friend_usa "a_friend_usa"
Reviews.Content: I love the small size and feature set. The leather case fits perfect. The discount with the free memory card is great too. This is a cool camera!I wish Canon would make this model with AAA or AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great cute camera
Reviews.Author: S. Jacob "sjk"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that you can carry anywhere in any small purse or pocket, this is the right one. It's even smaller than my iPhone. I love to carry it practically every where. The images are really great too.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for just the right price!
Reviews.Author: Brandon Mead "bam"
Reviews.Content: Short and simple, this camera packs a lot of content in a small package.Pros:-Light weight-Very compact-Almost no shutter lag-Easy to use-720p HD video-Many moreCons:-Viewfinder is useless-Buttons feel a "flat"-Only 3x zoomOverall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera not such great service..
Reviews.Author: La La "la la"
Reviews.Content: I Love the product!! The camera is wonderful.. still getting use to it but great!  My beef is with Amazon.. I had awful service this go around, which is unusual!  I ordered the camera waited the 10 days.. nothing.. called.. and they were like oh well wait a little longer.. what?? Then after two more days and nothing I called again and they sent out another one.  3 day shipping.. So kinda mad about that!  Cause I needed it for an event and I had ordered it in plenty of time.. I just felt they weren't very helpful at all! :(  and it could have been the person I dealt with!

Reviews.Title: canon power shot sd78ois
Reviews.Author: D. Harris
Reviews.Content: picture color has been great. don't forget to order a disc because there is not one with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Extremely cute and usable pocket cam with very low IQ
Reviews.Author: Luving it
Reviews.Content: Comparing to my DSLRs - no comparison.Comparing to my Casio Exlime, same IQ, but better video.Pro:- Extremely cute, well build, look&feel;, better than all others I've tried, Nikon Coolpix, Casio Exlime, Sony.- Great usability for a pocket P'nS cam - very responsible shutter, ultra fast FA, IS seems to be effective.- Good video quality with AF.- Intuitive user interface. No need for manual really.Con:- Lousy picture quality. Very lousy indeed. This point alone defeats all the pros it has for my purpose. I just need something to be constantly in my pocket in case my DSLR is not available or connenient. I remember the older Digital Elph to be bigger and more expensive but with much better IQ indoor or outside. This new Elph is a lot cheaper but the IQ is just like any other cheap cam from any other brand - a huge disappointment for my purpose. Like another reviewer said - 12MB pixel is just a marketing hoax that makes the file unnecessarily big. The IQ really isn't much better than my Canon video cam shooting still at 3MB. Ok, maybe a little better :) But not by much.Bottom line - A great pocket cam with very disappointing IQ. For my purpose, it's useless, which really is unfortunate. Because otherwise I really love this little cam.

Reviews.Title: A great buy!
Reviews.Author: Michelle I. Brownstein
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a week and so far it is great. I bought it for taking very close-zoomed pictures of products I make. Quality of pictures is excellent once you figure out the right settings. I highly recommend this if you are an amateur interested in doing more with your camera.The only drawbacks are: The settings are somewhat confusing and take time to figure out (but they do a great job and offer alot of manipulation for this price range)The video quality is not as good as others have indicated. Its fine, but nothing amazing.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Greg "smitz0327"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes very good pictures and the video does look great. I did notice on a few occasions when the lighting was bright you had some lines going through it when using video but worked good over all. I recommend the camera for the average user out there. A little small but I got used to it. I had to download the itunes to watch the video on my computer but no big deal

Reviews.Title: I dont like it
Reviews.Author: A. Melek "Joeb"
Reviews.Content: I Buy this camera from good reviews  but when i try it i'm not satisfied. indoor photograph quality is too low ,when shoot in auto mod its choose high iso speeds and pictures come useless when choose p mode and adjust the iso speed to 80-100-200  quality increase a little bit. I dont test the outdoor quality but hd video quality not much from my oldest ixus 50 camera also photo quality is less then my ixus 50. The body quality of this camera is also bad the battery lid already  ready to open  and when i push the on off button i afraid to crash my camera. I like Canon brand and i'll always choose this brand and i use EOS 40D for 2 years and i like it too much. But i'm very disappointed with this camera because my oldest ixus 40 & ixus 50 cameras with less technical features and less megapixel sensors  they shoots more successful photos. If you want to buy this camera first try it.

Reviews.Title: Whoooaa!
Reviews.Author: Brian A. Lugo "B Lug"
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera. pictures look great. shipping was very fast... 3 days faster than I expected. highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: Terrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon customer
Reviews.Content: Pros: credit card size makes it practically invisible in a pocket, decent video qualityCons: very poor picture quality, except for portrait modeI read all positive reviews and purchased this camera, but was very disappointed. As many reviewers noted the ultimate picture quality is worse than 4 megapixel Canon cameras of yore. Not a single picture I took was sharp, both in auto and manual modes. Digital noise is horrible at any ISO setting but 80. Considering the fact that this camera has an aperture of 3.2, the ISO 80 can only be used at bright daylight or with flash at close-up. I suspect that the absence of sharpness is due to very aggressive noise reduction algorithms combined with small sized ridiculously high 12 megapixel sensor in this camera. These algorithms make any backlight shot intolerably bad, mangling facial features beyond recognition. If Canon used a 6-8 megapixel sensor, the quality would have been way, way better.Compared to Canon S90 this camera is a joke. S90 is small, takes great pictures, and video though not HD is still excellent. I wish its price were on par with 780IS, but I guess you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality in Auto Mode
Reviews.Author: forrkp
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this camera. This is the 2nd camera that I will be returning after disliking their picture quality. I wonder what has happened to camera manufacturers. I was expecting better results from Canon. I used to own a Canon PowerShot A95 and loved it. It worked beautifully for me for several years.
